description: What an awesome place. We got the cottage pie and the burger and both were quite good. The service and the general ambience were just great and I loved it that there was a fire in the hearth! Definitely coming back here whenever we can!
author: Katie S.

description:
Time: 10:06pm
Place: Durty Nelly's
Date: 12/31/17

This review is LIVE

Unlike the Durty Nelly's one would see on a regular day, the Irish bar right now is raging. Instead of old timers playing bar side GM for the Giants, young handsome men in dressy button downs are drunkenly singing along to Mr.Brightside. Pretty ladies are slinging bottles with skirts and dresses short enough for the occasion. There are carry over christmas decorations to keep the holiday feelings alive, and for tonight only, a party of balloons are bobbing joyfully on the ceiling.

The alcohol pours graciously from the bar. Big shoutout to the two warriors working behind the counter. Unperturbed from the volume of work and the task of working NYE, their smiles and patience keeps the walkway of Durty Nelly's a makeshift dance floor for the inspired and the spirited.

It's 10:16pm and group selfies are evident as brief flashes are scattered here and there. Hugs and shaky hands, sips and mouth-to-ear whispers, outside pizza and outdoor smokes. No one seems to understand each other, but it's an understanding fit for tonight.

The ups and downs of 2017 are forgotten in this one last hurrah. It's a heartfelt way to ring in 2018. Foggy memories and a slight hangover are all anyone will take with them. From one degenerate to another, few experiences are more beautiful.

It's 10:25, and i'm going to call it a year for Yelp. Thank you for reading and Happy New Years!
author: Ringo M.

description:
I'm giving Durty Nelly's five stars because it's our new (to us, since we just moved) neighborhood spot and has something for everyone in the family (specifically beer and veggie burgers for my husband, cheeseburgers and french fries for my son, and fish and chips for me). Yay! 

On my last visit with my son (which happened to fall on Super Bowl Sunday, which I had forgotten about...!) it was understandably loud and boisterous, still I felt comfortable with my seven-year-old sidekick and we enjoyed our intimate meal in the corner. It was perfect! 

Adam enjoyed his specially made for him lemonade -- thanks a bunch.
author: Camille L.

description: We went in to watch a college football game & it was the best choice we made. The bartender is really nice, will sit down & talk to you. The food is amazing also. Try the DURTY BALLS!!! Super good!!! Coolest Irish pub I've ever been to.
author: Salvador C.

description:
Nice friendly bar with good Guinness (3/5 green stars)
Quick review today: Durty Nelly's has perhaps one of the most welcoming storefronts (Barfronts? Facades?) that I've ever seen. Bright yellow and blue with window boxes and a red door. Sounds a bit garish but it works. We had Guinness and a few local beers (Anchor, I think, and an IPA), some garlic fries and a cheese toasty with more fries (!). Friendly barman and good atmosphere (although too many TV screens for my liking). 

I'm also giving them 3/5 Green Stars for social and environmental impact, based on these reasons:
* My main problem was that, while Guinness was served in a proper glass, the Anchor and IPA were served in plastic cups (with Bud Light logo). WHY?? Update from owner, Odie: it turns out that they only use plastic on their two busiest weekends (Hardly Strictly and Outside Lands). 
* The barman was helpful in explaining that the curry sauce was not vegetarian, so we ended up with the cheese toasty and fries, being almost the only veggie things on the menu. There's plenty of vegetarian food in Ireland these days, so why not serve more in an Irish bar? There's no shortage of vegetarians and vegans in SF.
author: James K.

description:
When friends asked me to meet them here for brunch, I was all :-\. In all my prior experiences, the food and service were... not good. Despite its proximity, I just didn't bother visiting.

When I got there, I was stunned. The menu looked great. The food was great. The service was great. Someone had transformed the place! 

The owners have created an oasis of comfort food and booze. Very tasty, homemade everything, very good value. They work very hard and care about their customers. Good music and local sports on the tube are a bonus.

Durty Nelly's is a gem of a neighborhood bar. So glad they're nearby!
author: Sarah B.

description:
The lady behind the bar was quite rude and made us feel unwelcome. She was obviously upset about something else and taking it out on customers, unless that's just the way she always is. Horrible!

*In their response to this review they are trying to say that I was mad that I got carded. Nothing like this ever happened. I'm in my thirties, I'm used to getting carded and I've never made a big deal about it. So I don't know where that comes from, unless they are mistaking me for someone else. The reality is that the lady behind the counter was just plain rude and it came out of the blue, and it had nothing to do with getting carded or anything like that. But it shows the attitude, doesn't it? Rather than apologize and offer to make amends, they accuse me of something that never happened. All the more reason not to go back.

**Now the owner won't stop sending harassing messages and calling me names. Boy was it a mistake going in there! I'm surprised they're still in business with that kind of piss-poor customer service.
author: Josh R.

description:
This is a necessary dive bar in a mostly Asian commercial
Neighborhood.  Chess event food in a cozy intimate environment close to beach, so the fireplace helps at night as that breeze blows. If you're in the area, it's perfect - but I wouldn't make it a destination. Service OK.
author: Bob B.

description: Favorite local Irish Pub with trivia nights & live music.  Try the  Durty Balls  & Curry Fries for bar bites, Shepherd's Pie or Fish & Chips are also great options!
author: Jon R.

description: Went in for scotch, walked out sober with a pretty expensive tab. The pours were well below standard shots. I would expect more from a neighborhood bar.
author: Mase S.

description:
Bartender is a fine lad but the full Irish breakfast didn't live up to the hype. Very salty meal, beans are good. The pudding is good. Bread, fries, ham, sausage are all way too salty. Couldn't finish the meal. Irish coffee was ok. Bloody Mary wasn't the best. 

The bar it self is cozy and nice. Would go fork a drink but not for some Irish grub.
author: Brandi P.

description:
My first negative experience here was after work with colleagues. We sat down, ordered food and beer, and then when the food and beer came out, they asked for our IDs. At the time, we were all ladies in our mid-20s, arguably pretty young looking, so this was clearly valid and in good practice. However, when he saw our IDs, the bartender accused us all of having fakes so we offered to show him our teacher IDs and a corresponding credit card to validate our identities. He refused and said he was still going to charge us for the beer because he had already poured it, but not serve it to us. What. So we ate, tipped him on the food (why? we shouldn't have since he charged us for drinks we didn't get to drink), and left, vowing never to come back.

Flash forward: I come back. Everywhere is worth a second chance, and the food *was* tasty. So my friend and I order, over the course of a night, 2 beers each and 1 mixed drinks each. We close out. The non-itemized bill is over $60.00. What? We know we didn't drink that much. We ask for an itemized, but the bartender ignores us until we put a card down. Upset that she won't show us the itemized, we tip $6 ($1 per drink, which isn't The Best, but is also somewhat standard). Two days later, I check my email and see a receipt from Square. We were charged for two extra drinks that we didn't order AND the bartender tipped herself a total of $16 (MORE than 20% on a bill that was already over-charged). 

Two strikes, this bar is out. Unfortunate, considering the food is good, the atmosphere is pleasant, and the clientele are *super* friendly.

Update: As you can see, the owner threatened me privately because I left a one star review. He made false accusations against me regarding illicit drug use and told me he would send video footage of me drinking and doing drugs to my boss to have me fired. As someone who has never used drugs recreationally, I'm not sure why he thought this was a way to get me to remove my review. 

I also have a picture of my receipt, written trying to get a near dead pen to work, and the picture the owner showed me does not match mine. It's unfortunate when a business can't handle a $10 dispute with professionalism. 

The security footage also apparently shows my friend and I drinking "30 glasses of water," which is certainly hyperbole. But yes. We did drink a lot of water because one drink should always be followed by one water. I'm sorry this was viewed as "belligerent." Happy to share screenshots of the direct messages he sent to me.

Also, please do read my other reviews. I've given a lot of 4 and 5 star reviews for places in San Francisco that I would highly recommend! I even stated in this review the positives of Durty Nelly's. I won't be back, but new clientele is certainly welcome to. :)

Day 29: The $10 still has not been refunded, despite claims from the owner.
author: Tiffany S.

description: Everyone who gives Nelly's less than five stars are just plain wrong.  The bartenders are all friendly, they serve great pub food, and the atmosphere is super good.  Great pub.
author: Ben T.

description:
We had a pretty good experience... 

Aside from the obnoxious 40 something year olds who were congregated by the bar smh. They wanted to be sooooooooo cool so they made sure everyone knew they were there. They were slamming cups and hollering and cursing up a storm -__- 

The owner/Bartender was nice.  He made sure my husband was happy with the tv that was facing us. He played his music loud and sang even louder lol!!

The food was delicious. We ordered curry fries as an appetizer. I got the Golden Gate burger and Hubby got the Bacon BBQ burger.. patties were moist and flavorful. The fries were perfect and crispy!! 

If my husband were writing this review he'd probably give more stars but I wasn't digging being there. (It was Hubby's restaurant pick)
author: Miracle B.

description: Dirty balls were great!   Cottage Pie was excellent!  Friendly atmosphere that I would definitely return to!
author: Tim W.

description:
A nice, neighborhood pub ... some might refer to it as an Irish Pub but the clientele was pretty diverse when I was there.

My friend from out of state, an unofficial judge of hamburgers, told my group that theirs was "one of the three best burgers" he's had in the U.S. and he's been around.

Ours was an afternoon visit. The food and drinks were all good and the service was very friendly and helpful. I plan to return.
author: Gary K.

description:
A fine place for a burger.

Dropped in Saturday, October 22, 2016. 12 noon ish.

Ordered the burger combo with choice of cheese: blue, swiss, mozzarella ; comes with fries.

It tasted damn good, juicy tender and flavorful. The bun was moist and the tomato, onion and lettuce were fresh. Fries were tasty as well. $11.99

Added a pint of IPA , $6. Satisfying.

My friend had the chicken strips and said they were good.

When I walked in , everyone turned around and stared at me; a few seconds later, my friend, a cute blonde followed up and everyone turned back around. Just telling it like it is.
author: Bert K.

description: Amazing place!!! The music was awesome and the environment and atmosphere was great! If you are looking for a relaxing but fun place I would recommend this place, great people to be around.
author: Kat H.

description: New to the neighborhood and was made to feel right at home at this cozy little pub. I enjoyed some beers and a delish grilled cheese and tomato basil soup. I'll definitely be back.
author: Tara R.

description: Stopped in here after spending the day at de Young museum in Golden Gate Park. I heard the Sunset has a contingency of Irish bars and wanted to check one out. We initially stopped in for a drink but ended up eating too. I had the cottage pie and my girlfriend had a veg burger. Both good. What we really loved though were the garlic fries we had as an app. In total we had three beers, an app and entrees for about $50. Not bad for SF. Bartender was pleasant and decor was what I would expect from an Irish Pub along with a cozy fireplace. I'll stop back in when I'm in the area.
author: Tyler M.

description: I've gone to Durty Nelly's for years and have seen the same blonde woman working the bar every visit. She is never the friendliest but from this most recent visit her behavior was not only RUDE but also outright WRONG and ILLEGAL. We paid our bill with no tip due to the level of disrespect we received this time and found out days later after looking at our card statement that she ADDED IN A $20 TIP FOR HERSELF AFTER WE LEFT. How drunk did she think we were?! Yes it's only $20 and boohoo she must be frustrated with her job but she CANNOT ADD MONEY IN TO A SIGNED BILL. Thankfully the bank voided this charge altogether but I'm writing this review as a WARNING to anyone else who goes here.
author: Cassandra M.

description: Looked liked a good place for a bite after hanging out in the Haight all day. Place is cozy with a fireplace going and a few booths along the wall opposite the bar. Owned and run by Irish it's worth the trip for the ambience and definitely for the food which is a mix of American and English and Irish fare. The menu sports bangers and mash, fish n chips, mincemeat pies and nice huge burgers. The special when we went was pork chop dinner. We had the Durty Balls appetizer (yummy), Cottage Pie (screaming good), and the fish n chips (perfect). It looked like everything was good, it was hard to decide what to eat. We will definitely be back.
author: Chris D.

description:
This place is a true neighborhood gem. 

Food is great. Beer selection is good. Booths are cozy. It's our favorite place to spend a rainy Saturday afternoon.
author: Caitlin N.

description:
Was looking for a place to get some food on a Sunday afternoon and Durty Nellys had good reviews.

Food: 4/5
I ordered a Nellys burger and it was pretty big with a decent portion of fries (which were super crispy, just how I like them!) My friends ordered the fish and chips (which were two HUGE pieces) and chicken strips. Taste-wise, it's good but nothing mind-blowing. 

Customer Service: 4/5
Waitress/bartender kinda took awhile in the beginning but was nice. She also let us know ahead of time that she'll get busy once it's crowded (she was the only bartender on shift) but we should feel free to come and order at the bar if we need anything else. 

Seating/Cleanliness: 5/5
Women's bathroom was very clean! Dining area was also nice - we ended up with 8 people sitting around a booth and we all fit pretty comfortably!
author: Jenny T.

description: Came here to watch game 6 with some friends. Bartenders are awesome and drinks are cheap. Great atmosphere! Food was good too, only sad thing was that they ran out of fish for fish and chips but other than than, would highly recommend
author: Emily T.

description:
Pub food was something my friend couldn't stop talking about so I decided to go with him to an Irish pub since he kept hyping about their fried food!

ATMOSPHERE:
The pub had a very pub feel to it. We decided to sit on the bar. The place was dimly lit which kind of bothered me at first but got used to it. There were some tables and some booths. What I liked was that there was a fireplace and they lit it during our stay.

FOOD:
We ordered the curry fries and the durty balls.

Durty balls: 4/5 - I thought these were amazing! It's mashed potatoes in a shape of a ball and deep fried. What made it taste better was the sauce that it came with. I failed to identify it, but it had a bit of a spicy taste.

Curry fries: 5/5 - Their fries were amazing! With and without the curry. It had so much flavor I highly recommend getting this!

I also ordered a Guinness, which was very smooth. It was a bit bitter, but smooth. As someone who prefer sweet drinks, this was totally manageable. It got worse towards the end though so I stopped drinking it.

CUSTOMER SERVICE:
The service here was average. I was going to rate this place a 3 but the food definitely compensated for it. The guy in the bar just didn't seem like he liked his job and he seemed annoyed that we kept asking for things which totally brought the vibe down.

Would I come back here? YAAAS! Would I recommend this to a friend? YAAAS!
author: Aj C.

description: This is a good pub, nice and quiet. We had the fish and chips and curry chicken chips. Both very good. Small portions but still filling. I would definitely recommend this place for a good small bite. Also very good for watching sports!
author: Genesis C.

description: One my favorite dive bars in the area. I do go to this bar often and it's always a good idea.Very friendly crew and awesome food. I definitely recommend the dirty balls and any of the burgers as well.
author: Yas J.

description: They don't have chicken strips anymore - it's now chicken bits (mini nuggets). Too little food for $10 and the fries were very soggy.
author: Olivia H.

description:
Always have enjoyed this lively place for karaoke night.. However I was disgusted to see an extremely racist photo posted near the men's bathroom. It is an old school photo of a white baby eating bread with an Afro baby clearly begging for the smallest piece himself. 

Come on now!! Even if it's a "historic" piece of art, it represents a racist ideology and a time period of blatant Jim crowism.. Today we live in a world where the legacies of slavery are still present and having this racist photo up in a bar in SF of all places is completely unacceptable.

I will not be giving any more of money to a bar that promotes the institution of white privilege.
author: Marry A.

description: Stopped in this gem after work on a Tuesday afternoon. Nice community pub to wet the whistle and such. Great staff, great cliental and would recommend this place to watch a game for sure. Also, they have a fire place that actually works! Real wood, real fire burning! Smells like home!
author: Paul G.

description:
I can't believe it's taken me this long to write a review of this place. No seriously. I'm not joking... 

10 years ago my now husband and I were looking for something to do in San Francisco. We had just move to the outer sunset a week before we stumbled upon this place. Our first interaction:

Guy gets kicked out of the bar. Lights up a smoke and we walk in. Not 3-5 minutes later comes back in and orders a pint. We look a little puzzled but went with the flow. The guy that kicked him out said "he just needed to cool off". From that point we were intrigued. Not knowing it was a cash bar we ordered beers and shots. At the end of the night they said it was a cash bar and as my husband was going out to the ATM, the bartender said something we had never heard before in the history of bar hopping. "Welcome to San Francisco your drinks are on the house".  We had at least 3-4 shots with beers. 

From that point on we were loyal customers and going out almost every weekend, we got to know the owner and the head bartender well. There were nights that were just crazy there and then there were nights where it was a nice chill environment. 

The one thing that sticks out to me the most was at the end of the night everyone sings the Irish national anthem and somewhere over the rainbow. I hope they still do this because it was an awesome tradition and one we talk about to this day. 

Out of all the restaurants and bars we visited this place sticks out the most with some of the best (and worst) memories. I'm glad this place is still going and I may have to come grab a pint again my next trip to SF.
author: Chrissay z.

description:
Interesting and friendly place. But watch what you order, it adds up quick. A couple burgers and beers will set you back about $40, which might be a surprise.

Lamb burger was very tasty, as was the regular cheeseburger with bacon. But the outstanding thing here is their fries- just amazing. Hand cut and cooked perfectly.
author: T J.

description: I dropped in here with a buddy last night for a drink and ordered two Makers Mark manhattans. It took a few minutes for the bartender to notice me (it wasn't that crowded). Wasn't the most friendly service nor welcoming to a new patron. To be honest, it was a nice little Sunset neighborhood Irish pub and a nice atmosphere, but I had to admit that I didn't feel particularly welcome in here last night. The manhattans were ok other than the pours of both drinks were uneven and light (in my opinion). It was an almost all white clientele in a heavily Asian neighborhood. Just an observation.
author: Norm D.

description:
There are three places I've been going to in the city as long as Durty Nelly's and none with such a warm place in my heart. 

My co-worker met her husband here. My uncle came to the bar that was here in the 80's. I've escaped here more times after Midnight Mass, Bay to Breakers or Outside Lands than I can remember.

I've had more close-calls, lock-ins, missed-connections, epic adventures and nights I'll never forget (although my liver might prefer to). 

It's home. It's a party.  It's a friend (love you Odie). 

It's everything you ever wanted and more, and what's best, the location eliminates the Marina D-baggers, Mission Hipster-WannaBe's, Tech-no-brats, and Bridge and Tunnel (yes, we technically have ONE tunnel and of course, it has a rainbow over it) crowd.
author: Mike V.

description: I walked into this place with my friend on a whim because it was freezing outside- it was incredible - there was a crackling fire, and Christmas decorations -it seemed like everyone was Irish too, I felt like I was in Dublin ! I highly recommend their Irish coffee - they have homemade whip cream and don't skimp on the whiskey , even the bartender was drinking one
author: Rachel R.

description:
Needed a place to catch up with a buddy, we decided to skip the typical boba thing that is prevalent on Irving in favor of a cold beer. Knowing of only one place in the area, I walked over to meet my friend in front of Durty Nelly's, a staple dive in the Sunset.

I got my regular, a snakebite, which didn't seem that common or popular in this bar as the bartender had to confirm with me that I wanted the Guinness and cider version. I know some like it made with different brews, but this version is definitely my favorite. Luckily they had some cider available and I could kick back with my favorite cold one and do some catching up and talk shop.

The bartender was super friendly and it's a fun place to hang out and enjoy a beer during downtimes, but not the quietest place once things pick up. Prices are reasonable though there are certainly better deals. It's a welcoming place at most hours so I'd definitely recommend it for a good time. Stop by for a pint!

Food: 7/10

Service: 8/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Love this place. Great food and entertainment.
Thanks Odie and Carolina for all the good times,
Best Irish bar in SF by far.
author: Julio J.

description:
Perfect Pint alert: one of the best Guinness short-line taps in the city yields a memorable pour.

Durty Nelly's is a delightful reminder of the Sunset's Irish heritage! Friendly, fun and the perfect place to watch the game. The activity level in the well-worn bar can range from quiet (Sunday afternoon) to off-the-hook-why-is-this-bearded-stranger-hugging-me raucous (Sunday afternoon with 49ers or Giants in the playoffs).

Bartenders and wait staff are attentive and dive-bar efficient. Food is standard bar fare and it's good!
author: John H.

description:
Fun Karaoke on Thursdays, they're very close to the park so they make a great pit-stop.
Food is great, especially the burgers and fries. Ill have to come back on a Wednesday for trivia, sounds like fun. 
Edit: I tried their food special, pork chop dinner. SPECTACULAR!!! Kudos to the chef making such great food in such a small place.
author: Cliodhna R.

description: Bartender with multi colored hair never looked up in the 5 minutes it took her to make 4 drinks.  6 new patrons walked in during that time, she never asked who was first, just helped the most convenient customer closest to her..  Had to walk out, doubt she even noticed.
author: Bill G.

description: Food was so-so.  The full Irish breakfast had squishy white-bread toast, French fries and a dollop of out of the tin beans, the rest was fine though the serving was rather small.  Fish and chips prepared better but still small portion for price.  Oh, well - live and learn.  Looking at the other reviews most of those folks may have been ossified and most things are good in that state.
author: Mariah C.

description: Great neighborhood pub. Trivia on Wednesday nights and karaoke on Thursdays. The bartender is really nice and fun. Great place for a drink or two or to catch the game!
author: Sherry L.

description: Home of the "Lamb Burger"... As soon as I saw the place from the street where I parked, I was drawn to it :) There is a sign hanging on the outside above the window says: "Come in a stranger, leave as friends".... And they mean it! I had lunch there. "Lamb Burger" by the cozy fireplace... I loved it. Don't miss out on this place and the Lamb Burger they offer here, if you are in the area...
author: Oya C.

description: Small Irish Pub.   Smallish menu.  Mostly burgers and hot sandwich selection.  Burgers were very good.  A generous portion of delicious french fries came with the burger.  We seated ourselves next to the door since it was the only table available.  The man checking ID's smoked right outside the door and the smell constantly lingered in during our stay.  Otherwise it was a pleasant experience.
author: Dennis J.

description: Came here for late night snacks and drinks. Great atmosphere and loved the warm and cozy fireplace. I had the curry fries, and it was delicious. A little on the salty side but pairs well with beer.
author: Chrisy T.

description:
There are a few times in life when you just haven't eaten all day long and then you have a big fat hamburger w fries- the original hamburger. 
Order it. Thats all I have to say. It's only $10

The Moscow Mule? Not so great. Get a beer instead
author: S L.

description:
Classic place! 
Great little hole in the wall Irish pub. Limited tap selection, but it has the basics to pair with the burger and fries. If you're looking for a cozy booth and great pub food to catch up with good friends, this is the place! The original burger with mushrooms, jalapeño, medium rare- delicious!
author: Shelby B.

description:
This place sure is cozy - they even have a fireplace going all night! It's a tiny little nook out in Outer Sunset. It has a nice dark, warm appeal to it. There is a small bar area and a few tables. I came in with a big group but we were able to pull a few stools and crowd around one of the booth areas. 

DRINKS
-Irish Coffee. Good size of warm coffee + whiskey. 
-Snake Bite cider/beer blend. I've tried this once before and noticed they had a sign up for it at Durty Nelly's. Crisp, refreshing, and easy to drink :)

PROS
-Good for medium sized groups!
-Not too crowded since it's all the way out in Sunset
author: Grace J.

description: Terrible service. Its a "no tip no service" bar or so the female bartender says.. Very rude and everyone trys to fight each other in this bar
author: Joey H.

description:
Durty Nelly's has undergone an ownership change. long time bartender, Odie, has taken over ownership. saw the "perfect pint" guiness claim after i asked him if the guiness was any good. YES!  Odie showed me the short lines from the beer keg to the tap. long supply lines dilute the brew.

perrused the menu: burgers(lamb too) , fish  & chips, chips, and irish entrees are all in da house..

pour: guiness(6)
-twas a perfect pint,
-even the foam was tasty.

drips:
-irish and chinese people go back to transcontinental railroad days (1863)
railroad connected east and west coast, trip took 6 days instead of 6 months overland. 
-reported 1200 chinese deaths(dyanamite and avalanches) and 100+ irish deaths 
disputed by Central Pacific historians.
-Odie has a pleasing irish accent.
-bar is small with a few tables and a long bar,
-many flatscreens
-just a few draughts.
-cool ambiance.
author: Victor G.

description: Chill Irish pub; friendly staff and I like the decor, even the bright yellow paint of the building's outside! Seems like the perfect little neighborhood bar.
author: Zara S.

description:
Came here for dinner at the end of a long day spent in Golden Gate Park.  Very chill place, no nonsense service and food.  Drinks and food came quickly.  I got the Moscow Mule, which was alright -- a little heavy on the lime but still good.  Ordered the Nelly's Burger, straightforward cheese and bacon burger, also good.  Ketchup at the table tasted like it was made with wine? Also good!  Shoutout to whoever was queuing up Hot Hot Heat songs on the  jukebox.

Would come again!
author: Christine C.

description:
Great, friendly, no-nonsense bartenders.
Delicious, juicy, reasonably priced burgers.
Chips could be a bit crispier but tasted delicious with a dash of vinegar.
50 cent wings on (I believe) Tuesdays?!

Yes, yes, yes. Good solid Irish pub to mind your own business or rub elbows with your neighbor. I also really enjoy the fire place burning away and the big booths all up against the wall. They also have 5 large TVs which makes it a prime spot for Giants games- just gather some buds, a booth, a burger, a brew, and BAZINGA *
author: Sophie H.

description:
Craving a burger lunch in a cozy pub, we made our way to Durty Nelly's. Upon entering, we were greeted with a friendly hello by the bartender. She was welcoming and helpful and handed us a couple of menus letting us know that she could come around to us if we wanted to have a seat at one of the booths, or we could order at the bar. We opted to save her the trouble of walking around to us and ordered directly - a couple Guinnesses, a burger and a grilled BBQ chicken sandwich (requested without the bun). 

I was impressed there were *five* TV's - three were above the bar, one above the back of the pub, and one above the front area - I figure they're gearing up for the Big Game tomorrow. 

Our food came out in good time - the burger tasted fresh and delicious and came with a decent amount of fries. My grilled BBQ chicken sandwich also came with fries and was crisp, tender and lovely. Good sauce.

This pub has a convivial, locals vibe where folks of a broad range of ages (over 21) mix and mingle. When we arrived in the early afternoon, there were a small handful of patrons and a nice crowd gathered shortly after.

Durty Nellys - a pub with good food, drinks and merriment!

If you're curious about who Durty Nelly was in Irish lore: http://www.durtynellys.ca/who-was-durty-nelly.php
author: Cathy K.

description: The durty balls are good mashed potatoes. The burger was good. I've seen better Irish pubs before. The bartender was attentive and nice but the girl who delivered the food was extremely rude.
author: Will D.

description:
What the? After reading all the great reviews on Yelp, I decided to try the food here. I wasn't expecting much, but I was clearly wrong. The burger I ordered was, if not exceptional, truly excellent, and far better than I might have expected from a neighborhood bar. In particular, the meat was flavorful and perfectly cooked. I'm not much of a drinker (exactly what, then, was I doing in an Irish bar, you may ask), but the Guinness we shared was fresh and Guinness-y.

The service, I have to add, was  -- let me just describe it as "matter of fact" -- with a bit of East Coast attitude ("I might be your friend for life, but first you gotta prove you're not an a-hole").  I liked it.
author: Richard A.

description: Worth it! 3days before st Patrick's day and we're in an Irish pub. Food didn't disappoint we had the beef and Guinness stew and the Durty balls. Guinness and lagunitas ipa on tap. Bartender was super friendly and the tiny place was pretty damn busy. Go!
author: John P.

description: What a fun place. Great little fun bites that were so much fun to try with my kids. Favorites were curry chips and battered sausage. People here are so friendly. Loved the experience. Have to try it.
author: Tam S.

description:
It's refreshing to walk into a bar and automatically want to cozy up in their welcoming booth seating, situated right by their charming fire place (which was unlit at the time). Durty Nelly's is a real pub  - bursting with character and hospitality. There are no loud garish TVs mounted on the wall here. The place has a rustic feel about it and is decorated accordingly. The place isn't dim or dismal - and instead the lighting is warm and refreshing. The bartender is genuine and personable.

You can actually hear yourself speak and while we were too late to try their food menu - their curry chips are lauded as a winning dish. Not too late in the evening  - a beaming bachelorette party stumbled in and even offered up slightly obscene cupcakes to us and the bar staff.  One of those rare moments - where women by far - out-number men at a Sunset pub.

I was on a quest to discover a bar/pub in the area that truly resonated with me - and Durty Nelly's was the true standout. Intimate and unassuming. Pure delight for a mellow Sunday evening.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: I love this place.  Authentic Irish bar with a fantastic vibe. Although I'm not a irish, they make this Asian porkster feel at home. Good simple bar food. I give this place two curry fries thumbs up!!
author: The Chubby Asian ..

description: Awesome food and really nice employees. My favorite part was watching a 50 year old drunk woman repeatedly drunk dial her ex. Very fun place!
author: Julie G.

description: Pretty much the best pub in the City! It is in the Outer Sunset, so, it is freezing a lot of the time. But they always have the place nice and warm with the fireplace and the food menu is pretty delicious. I have never had a bad experience here!
author: Natalie N.

description:
Easily the most random and strange night of my life.

Meet up with 2 friends from decades past. Decide to get a beer. Can't find parking (SHOCKER) in Lower Haight, or anywhere within a 10 block radius. Decide to drive... and just keep driving. Debate getting 40s and drinking them on the beach. Nixed because we're too old. End up parking in the first available spot surrounded by tiny restaurants selling bubble tea and noodle dishes. Eh? Where are we?? 

Stumble upon a bunch of smokers. Decide we must be at a bar, especially when we see the Irish flag waving in the foggy breeze. What divey-dive of all dives have we here?? So durty it's spelled with a "u"?? How wonderful!! We got a table smack in the middle of the fray and ordered a few brews. A long-haired man in sandals was wailing into the microphone, playing jams on his guitar that included "Purple Rain," "Proud Mary," and John Mellencamp. The crowd was a mix of college girls (high school girls?), sloppy too-old-to-be-frat-boys, PDA couples, and elderly drunks who may or may not come sit at your booth. Some people danced. Some had their dresses accidentally tucked up into their panties after visiting the loo. Others spontaneously bust out with what appeared to be choreographed tap dance moves up and down the length of the bar, even when the guitar player was on a break.

Said friends and I sat in our booth - sometimes pinned in, other times simply afraid to leave - laughing 'til we cried at the show that unfolded before us. 

Sometimes a dive is just a dive. And then sometimes it's Durty Nelly's, and you're planning an Anniversary Date for your return.
author: Ray J.

description: What a great spot! Dingy enough to be a rustic Irish pub, and clean enough to feel comfortable eating their delicious hamburgers (best in the Sunset, hands down!!). If I'm craving some me time with Guinness, this is where I go.
author: Matthew F.

description:
Lots of locals....  commence with the drinking, arguing, yelling, dancing on chairs, etc.

Drinks = beers, beers and some hard liquor.  I stuck with their beers... and a car bomb.  lol  

Cash only!
author: Fannie S.

description: Durty Nelly's has been the local bar I've been looking for forever, great burgers, drinks, and they show MotoGP!!! Been coming here months: love the music, atmosphere, and vibe. Looking forward to my next pint.
author: Ben M.

description: Terrible, rude bartender. Came in for a burger at 10 and got kicked out. Maybe I just got unlucky, anyways I'm not coming back.
author: Sydney S.

description:
I really liked this place. I don't suppose there is really anything special about it, but it feels like home. The service is friendly-but busy; there is only one bartender on at a time and the bar gets pretty full, but you still don't have to wait very long. I feel like most people need to learn a little patience anyway.

Order at the bar and bring cash. There seems to be a few traditional items that aren't on the menu so don't be afraid to ask what they're hiding back there. I got a burger and it was delicious. It tasted exactly the way a burger should. I can leave satisfied on that alone.

At the same time, the Guniness was good, a solid 8.5/9.0 out of ten. The bartenders on the other hand... well I just have one thing to say about them... they were great! Rory and Carolina will get whatever you need with a smile. Don't be "that guy" anywhere you go, though and remember to enjoy your night!
author: Jaime W.

description:
I really wanted to like this place.  I really did.  The service was good.  The ambiance was, well, drab, dreary, dull.....and always with that ONE oddball at the bar, that looks as if he didn't take his meds this week.

But after a couple of visits now, I just can't get into it.  The chicken curry with fries is okay, but when you get a few bites that taste like industrial cleaner, you just wonder wtf is up in the kitchen.  Maybe I just got spoiled with all those terrific Irish pubs in Northern Virginia.  Big, clean, great food, ambiance, decor and vibe.  Not to mention a plethora of draft beer selections.

Oh well, at least I gave it a try.  Go check it out and decide for yourself.
author: Anthony D.

description: First time here and the bartender was really rude and completely rushing our order. Bad first impression but hopefully next time will be a better turnout.
author: Lisa H.

description: Looking for a place to with a Cheers vibe where everybody knows your name? Well durty nellys is the place, where people are friendly and drinks are cheap & simple. The food here isn't too bad either. It's pretty clean for a dive bar and the bartender is always cool. There's usually an obnoxious drunk hanging out at the bar but they are harmless and the bartenders are good about regulating them. Great place to just hang out with some entertaining people watching.
author: Christine H.

description: A neighborhood institution with hilarious Irish people, trivia and karaoke to keep us entertained, and good food when the kitchen is open.
author: Carrie H.

description:
I have yet to find a bar in SF with such reasonable prices.  The crowd was an odd mix, but I loved it.  

DO NOT come here if:
You'll be offended by an old drunk guy humping your leg
You expect to meet hot models in heels

DO come here if:
You're looking for just some nice people who don't give a f*ck about anything other than having a good time.
author: Michele S.

description: Really lively place with a lot of room to dance. Kitchen closes at 9:30pm, so I can't say too much about the food. It's pretty much always busy here, so you'll be standing at some point. Tap list is short, and they've got your standard liquors. Fake fireplace is going, a few tvs are on. It's definitely a place in the outer sunset that stands out because every other place is closing at 12am due to serving food along with alcohol, or it's a dive bar. Service is friendly, and you can get drinks pretty quickly here. This place has karaoke on some nights too. They used to have trivia night, but I didn't see any indications of that when I went last night.
author: Danny C.

description:
Excellent place. Had the Steak & Kidney Pie special which was delicious. It's only two blocks from my place, and though I don't go there often, I always see it alive and buzzing with people. 

Cozy atmosphere, very friendly service. 

Highly recommend!
author: Tim H.

description: Love this place.  Great people.  You can't beat the location in the high outer Sunset.  The fireplace is a marvelous bonus. Food awesome.  Unlike so many pubs in America, you don't need to be drunk to appreciate it.  Neighborhood feel.  Real Irish. Real. Period. Curry and chips!
author: D.J. L.

description:
So a few months have passed and I've visited a few more times... and Durty Nelly's has continued to be AWESOME.

But could you possibly be more awesome?

YES.  YES, YOU CAN!

And how do you ask?  By introducing me to the lamb burger and a nutty Irishman.  The lamb burger smells intoxicating to the point you just want to sit there with it and not ruin the moment by eating it.  Alas, starvation kicks in and you take your first bite and it's like a gyro perfected in burger form.  DEEEE-LISH!

I came in a naive Sunset-er and learned the deliciousness that is a Nutty Irishman (which the bartender was kind enough to introduce me to the shot and the drink... both delicious!).  And if you're not in the mood for something creamy, a black and tan will go just fine with that tasty burger!

CONTINUE WITH YOUR AWESOMENESS THAT IS THE LITTLE BAR ON IRVING STREET AND GO VISIT!
author: Christine K.

description:
Super fun, small neighborhood bar. 

Loved the vibe and the food! 

Came for the Niner's/Seahawk's game a few weeks ago and everyone was super excited and it was def a fun lively crowd. 

Ordered the fish n chips and they were delish! 

Was kind of difficult to order, but it was a crowded day. Come early on game days to ensure a seat! :)
author: Alison N.

description: I love this place. It is close to where I live and everyone is very friendly. I like the atmosphere, the drinks aren't overpriced, and they have fun things going on like karaoke. On a weekend it'll be pretty crowded, but in a good way. It's warm and inviting, and I love the new paint job as well. Haven't actually gotten a chance to come here in the "light of day" and try the food, but hopefully that's next!
author: Elise S.

description:
Great bar! Every other Tuesday night, they have a folk music night and my friend played the fiddle. The music is great and the group is really good! They were also playing the Australian Open on 4 out of 5 TVs. That's a win for tennis in general! The bartender supported my extreme fandom of Rafa Nadal and kept refilling my water to cool me off during the close match of 2014 against Dimitrov. I love a great bar, with great tennis, and a fabulous bartender who also knows his tennis! The beer selection is good and the bar food is also delicious. Now if only they took card...

The bar is very cozy for bar seating or restaurant seating. There is a fireplace to make you feel right at home. It's especially nice during those cold SF nights! The N-Judah stops right in front of the bar so you can always jump right on the N after a good night of drinking, sports, and music :)
author: Leena B.

description: Their Durty Balls are delish! Deep fried mashed potatoes with corned beef and cheese! So good. Also had the burger with really good fries. The burger was cooked the way I liked, it wasn't bad and it wasn't amazing. Also tried some fish n chips, which was made with good fish. The curry tartar sauce tasted fishy in a weird way, much better to not use that sauce but other than that it was good.
author: Kylie L.

description:
-got an update from someonefrpm the pub and found it very professional so I'm giving them back a star. It's not their fault that some people are drunken idiots. I will have to say that they need to filter out the crowd that tries to come in.-


 Came here on St. Patrick's Day. The bar was nothing special. A mini pub with no character...the crowd was... subpar and honestly DIRTY.

People were falling over each other, a girl fell off a booth and knocked down a table... this place had crazy written all over it. I guess when you come on their most "prideful" day of the year, this is what's going to happen.

Still, the bartenders were authentic and fun and the decor was true to an Irish pub. Come here for a quiet drink on an off day.
author: Hemang S.

description:
Place is okay, but certainly been to better. 

Came here on my birthday because I wanted to drink. Figured, might as well eat dinner here too. So we walked in, 3 Chinese guys into an Irish Pub and of course, everyone started staring us down. 

Place is a lot smaller than some of these pictures would lead you to believe. There a booths but seemingly no servers so everything has to get ordered at the bar. Bartender told us to make the people at the booth behind us leave because we were eating....lol. We waited until the food came out (about 20-25 minutes-ish) before doing so. 

Bangers and Mash...looked pretty mundane but my friend gobbled it up with no complaints. Shepards pie...potato overload. Along with the mashed potatoes normally on top of it, they gave me a lot of fries with it too. Pie was tasty though. Peppered steak....yikes. Tough steak, friend couldn't take it anymore but he liked the sauce. Garlic fries....was okay but was the first garlic fries I've had where it was actually bitter if eaten naked. Needs ketchup badly. 

Best part of the night was our encounter with what my friend could only describe as a "happy racist". Could tell he was a regular and was well past drunk, after his friend left he decided to talk to us. Took one look at me, asked me if I was a samurai....lol. Then he called us Japanese because we don't have Chinese eyes. After that he mumbled a lot with his Irish accent and we couldn't make out much of it. 

Definitely an experience and I could see coming back for a pint and to watch the game. Nice part is it's past the part of the Irving that usually is super busy and so parking was not much of an issue. So what did I learn here? 

- I am a samurai. 
- My friends and I might be Japanese. 
- The Irish are funny when drunk. 
- Tough steak. 

Good times, not great, but hopefully they do better the next time I stop in.
author: Alfred D.

description: Great little local, good crack and 'Gator games on the telly. We were visiting San Francisco, and friends dragged us out to the Bluegrass festival at Golden Gate Park. At four, we sprinted across the polo field, desperately seeking a sports bar. Apparently, there are a few Yelpsters in San Francisco, and they led us to this little outpost
author: Tom Y.

description:
I pick Brendan on my team for whatever...drinking, fighting, even dodge ball...he's one of those cool guys that just gets along with everyone.

When I walked in, I felt like I was transplanted to Farrington's Pub in the Temple Bar district of Dublin.  I heard lots of "Slainte" and "What's the craic" being tossed around, and that's how I knew it was a traditional Irish pub.  Irish music also plays at night, adding to the atmosphere of old Dublin.  I hear the burgers are not to be missed, and I'll be hitting that up on my next trip, along with a dozen pints of the black stuff.

Irish Pub in the middle of Irving's Chinatown...yeah, it fits, and if you have a problem with it, bring it up to Brendan.
author: Ron L.

description: Love this place. Makes me wish I still had thursday nights off so I could hit up the karaoke scene once more. Bartender is a nice lady and Ken, the KJ, is great.
author: Alexandra R.

description: Fun little bar I recently get to know from friends and not too far from my neighborhood . We went trivia night on Wednesday and it was a lot of fun.
author: Sophia H.

description:
My girlfriend and I were out on one of our weekend walks in Golden Gate Park and decided to venture out into the Sunset before we headed home, thinking we may find someplace nice and new to have dinner before the week started. We almost walked by Durty Nelly's but I pointed it out and we headed in. 

I instantly loved the ambience of the place. There's a TV, lots of dark wood, and a fireplace that wasn't lit when we were in, but Sunday nights are pretty slow and I hear it's on most of the time (it looked like it was, too). I grabbed a Guiness and she a cider, and we grabbed a table and ordered almost immediately. The service was great and incredibly friendly. 

The food was phenomenal. My lady had the fish and chips and I ordered the Sheperd's pie. I've been thinking about Sheperd's pie since we had it back in Maine over the summer, and have never just up and looked for a place to find it or even ordered at a place that did serve it. So glad I decided the bite the bullet and try it, because I absolutely cleaned my plate and could probably have done another (because of how delicious it was; the portion size was perfect). Overall, I'm looking forward to going back and trying the rest of their menu, and maybe even getting cozy by the fireplace in the near future.
author: John T.

description:
You know that treehouse you always wanted as a kid? Where you could hang out with your friends, chat, be silly and get up to no good? That's Durty Nellys! 

Except with booze....and trivia, and karaoke, and live music.....random out breaks of sing-songs and dance parties....And,well, booze. 

Great bartenders, really delicious food, and did I mention booze?? Seriously, it's...what do the kids say these days?...It's "the bomb", it's "hella cool yo", it's "totally rad!" And I kid u not, they serve....great food....(you thought I was gona say booze)
author: Allison F.

description: Loved Durty Nellies. My wife and I were driving to the airport after a fun weekend and decided to have lunch near Golden Gate Park. Looked on Yelp and found DN.  It was a Sunday afternoon so it wasn't too crowded but I think we were the only people of the 12 or so in there that didn't have an Irish accent.  The bartender was great. The food was above average for a pub, got the Nelly burger.  Very good burger, couldn't get enough of the garlic aioli. Awesome spot.
author: Patrick R.

description:
I come here for Trivia Nights every Wednesday. It's a good ole time. Never packed, but still really lively. The bartender is very attentive and gets your order quickly. I like that about the place. Drinks are also pretty cheap, so I can get tipsy without hurting my wallet. The food seems good, I've never gotten anything, but it looks decent.

Trivia is cool too. It gets progressively hard each rough though. I like that it's not crowded and that I can hear each question clearly. My team has won second place several times, which is pretty cool too.

I like this place for the ambiance and that it's not too crazy packed, even on a trivia night.
author: Andrew T.

description: I had a great time; no wait besst time at this Irish bar, I recommend you go to trivia night on Wednesday. It is a lot of fun, the bartenders were cool and the beer was cold.
author: Brandon P.

description:
Sliders are equivalent to Fuddrucker's. Yum yum good with beer, laughter, music and good company. 

They have a fireplace here which makes it homey like.
author: Jason C. J.

description: I want to like this bar, I really do. The ambiance is lovely and it has that authentic Irish pub feel. But it's WAYYY too small so it gets crowded fast and hard to get a drink.
author: Anastasia P.

description:
Freaking sliders- some of the best around. Only better is homemade or Fud Ruckers. 

General side salad with vinaigrette is SO good! The garlic dressing is def garlic-y so women/men be careful.

BLTA- solid, proportionate. Next time I'm going to request no garlic aioli. Too much for this sando. Reg mayo will be better.   

Curry fries, everyone is curious about them, they're good, I love curry, and I love fries, but not together. 

Service- so friendly, so helpful. Owners are Carolina and Otie. They are Irish and they do a fantastic job at tending bar. 

Wednesdays have trivia and Thursdays have karaoke, both are phenomenal. 

Atmosphere- hard to beat, good vibe, people sing dance and act a fool without being obnoxious. 
When watching major sports games you can usually find a nook to call your own. Not a possibility at Underdogs up the street. 
The regulars like soccer and Irish football, so we baseball/football/basketball fans are lucky here. 

Restrooms are TINY, and not all that clean.
author: Kortni S.

description: Charming Irish pub. Low key, great atmosphere. Love the fireplace!
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Nifty little spot .. cosy, small ... New food menu looks good - I will try it soon.  I love Trivia night there.  Bartendar very friendly ... One thing, please turn down fire or open window ... it gets so overheated.  Especially when crowded - and a 'crowd' in this small spot is about 20 people.  It was painfully & uncomforatably warm there  last Wednesday.  I melted.  

Otherwise, great spot .
author: J M.

description:
Came here on St. Patty's Day. It was the first Irish Pub we've been in. I was with two of the most obnoxious, awful human beings this city has produced. We even placed bets on who would get beat up first. Ironically, the only person we (and when I say we, I actually just mean Obnoxious Friend #1) pissed off was the only other Asian guy in the bar.

Anyways, lively, friendly crowd that just want to have fun. It had all the characteristics of an Irish Pub that I've imagined, WITH FISH 'N' CHIPS!

Not going to lie though, I was a little disappointed by the fact that a big, angry drunken Irishmen didn't beat up any of my friends. I guess there's always next year...
author: Andrew A.

description: What I have to say is simple. You want an excellent hamburger? Durty Nelly's is the place to get it. And I don't know how they do this: I always ask them to make it medium rare and they do. How do you do that? I've never been able to figure out how. Lucky for me I live almost right across the street from them. I was doing last minute taxes, was completely stressed out, depressed, headache and sick to my stomach. My wife said "go across the street and get yourself a hamburger", so I did and now I feel much better.
author: Gary S.

description:
As a Briton I was a little unsure about this Irish pub, since most of the pubs back home that call themselves that are just using it as a way to weasel out of doing good food or drink. I was very pleasantly surprised to discover an actual, honest to God pub just like they have back home. If you read the part of the menu "Nelly's Favourites" you wouldn't be able to tell you weren't in Ireland or Britain enjoying a meal at your local.

However, I came here on a friend's recommendation for the burger. I had Nelly's Burger which was fantastic, with good meat and garlic mayo and real bacon. The fries are pretty damn good and the half pint I had went well with my breakfast.

The reason I'm going to say four stars is twofold. Firstly the real pub atmosphere extends to the restrooms (toilets), which are as disgusting as the toilets back home would be. Given I wanted to wash my hands after the burger this was unwelcome. Secondly, the service was somewhat impersonal, with a bored-looking barmaid serving somewhat begrudgingly.

The business has just put up signs announcing new management, so I don't know how long this review will hold true. Hopefully it does for a while yet!
author: John C.

description:
Guinness served in a proper pint glass by a real irish person. This is a crowded but enthusiastic place to watch a giants or niners game on the weekends. The beer selection is limited, but this is more than made up for by the lively crowd and tasty fried food.

I came here for a friend's birthday to chill and it was the perfect environment to have a few drinks and catch up after a few months.
author: Palash A.

description:
There I was, stranded near Golden Gate Park without a car, hungry, accompanied by a hungry, impatient girlfriend, surrounded by Asian cuisine, which we weren't quite feeling.

And what's that? An Irish pub? That serves BBQ chicken sandwiches? SHUT UP AND TAKE MY MONEY.
author: Mark H.

description: The Chicken curry & chips were sooo good. Pair it off with a cold cider and call it a day.
author: Jango L.

description:
So... if you put "Full Breakfast" or "white and black pudding" on a menu, I'm probably going to wind up there. I had my eye on this place for a while so I was super happy when my friend suggested that we go here for dinner one night. 

It's a loud and rowdy bar, which you think I'd shy away from but they're jolly and kind (talking about the customers here) and the bartenders were great. I somehow decided to go with the curry chicken with fries, which I enjoyed with my glass of red wine. I think we all enjoyed our meals and drinks -- so pair that with good service and it's good all around.
author: Shauna S.

description:
I try to go back here every time I am in town. And every time I am in town, I scarf down one of their burgers so fast, my friends just stare at me, slack-jawed, that a human can eat that fast. I feel bad though. I eat so fast that I don't have time to really savor the burger.

There is a solution to this though. Drink a couple pints and order another burger.
author: Blair M.

description:
YES THEY HAVE A FIREPLACE. 

Do I even need to say anything else? What else could you do on a chilly winter night in the bay besides warm your insides and your outsides with flames and one of the devil's favorite brews. 

Your mind will be tickled by the real Irish accents as well. I maintain it gets no better than this. 

BUT the curry fries were disappointing. Get something else and enjoy the blaze.
author: Emily D.

description:
First time stumbled into this pub on a bored Saturday night and it was crazy experience. Sunset neighborhood has its share of few laid back pubs. But this place came as a complete surprise. The decor is nothing special, dark wood and has a few sitting booths. The crowd is mostly a weird mix of locals - mid-aged regulars, totally wasted drunks and wandering youngsters alike. But the surprising part was the music and the atmosphere. Was so fun to hear the latest club numbers playing in an Irish pub in the far Sunset! It immediately pumped everyone's spirit;  the crowd went crazy dancing on top of seats,in the floor and everywhere possible! Everyone was just having a good time. Didn't care must about what we drank as came out buzzed and rock and rolling.

The second visit was on St.Patty's Friday and hell , surprised us again! This time there was live music playing. The singer sang a good mix of popular classics to romantic numbers and song requests kept flowing all night. In between breaks were club numbers that got us dancing again! Made random friends, danced with the neighbors sitting beside and got free jagerbomb shots from the bartender, ohooo this place rocks Sunset! 

This place has its own crazy nights and if you in on one such night expect a few drunks stumbling around or in their crazy acts, the jolly Irish singing aloud, locals in their dancing shoes and no one here cares about anything else! Just come and have a good time.
author: Payal B.

description:
I went in to check out my local pub. Being new to the neighborhood, I wasn't sure of the welcome I'd receive - would it be the "local's only" vibe? Does food at a pub mean microwaved burgers? 

Turns out its a welcoming place with more than decent pub fare. The bartender pulled a great pint of Guinness and told us to stick around for the music later in the evening. The World Series played on one of two screens. Perfect!

Lookin forward to trying other items on the menu. I'm really excited this is my local pub!
author: Naomi L.

description: What a great place to have some beers and a bite. Super amazing staff, inviting atmosphere, killer grub, and a properly poured Guinness! Dirty balls (delivered by Dan the Chef himself) are a must, the fish and chips are on point (those fries are so good), and the Shepherd's pie will have you licking the plate. Put this in your life if you are into this kind of thing. Btw, Dan does BBQ for specials and he makes his own bbq sauce for the pulled pork or whatever the special is.
author: Kyle S.

description:
Where to begin? I've gone in three times now and the bartender is already predicting which beer will suit the day. 

The food is decent for pub grub. The atmosphere feel plucked directly from Ireland. I only gave it four stars though because on a weeknight this place shifts from ideal neighborhood pub to jam packed skeeze central. So I'd never recommend it past six, but it is a fantastic place to spend an afternoon with friends.
author: Ruth R.

description: Awesome! Live the feel of the place. Great bartenders and the food was delicious! This place reminds me of the Emerald Isle! Thank you for such a great treat!! Also, good luck to Roisan in your job! Your in great company because it's your family! Thank you for the shots as well!!!!!
author: Diane A.

description: So i have to say when i first arrived I was immediately greeted by the bartender, quick service, ordered the Durty Balls....this amazing glob of cheese, bacon and potatoes that had been deep fried.  DELICIOUS.  There was a shift change.  And in that time frame it was clear that a large local crowd was at the bar.  We felt kind of ignored for a bit and when the new bartender approached us, after having empty drinks for 20 minutes, the inquiry was "are you guys waiting on something?"  I don't really feel like that's how you treat a customer who's been ignored with empty glasses for 20 minutes.  Not "can I get you another ....or get you something?" This was the only factor that kept me from giving 5 stars.  The atmosphere is very quaint, fireplace and Irish decor.  We both ordered Fish & Chips and IT WAS AMAZING!  So as we sat there we jokingly decided that because the first bartender was a rock star and the food was so amazing that we would ignore the secondary service we received. We then ridiculously over tipped....and ta da.....everything was suddenly overwhelming friendly.  So we chatted some more....I think it was because we weren't locals or regulars...and maybe the second bartender was just taking care of the regulars....and I certainly can't blame her for that.  Either way....we both highly recommend this place for delicious food and a nice local not loud atmosphere.   We will go back....and I'd anticipate with a few repeat visits I'd be able to change this from 4 stars to 5 stars.  Thumbs up for Nelly.
author: Jason F.

description: Love love this bar. Despite living in the area hadn't been and after reading reviews decided to drop in on a random weeknight. The atmosphere is great, it's a sports bar with an authentic small Irish pub feel. There was a very assorted crowd, from youngins to old Irish men, and the vibe was very laid back and welcoming. The bartender was super nice. Ordered a BLT with avocado which had the most delicious bacon, and a few pints of beer. They have awesome happy hour deals for food and beer too. Will definitely be going back, left feeling great in a content and happy mood.
author: Liz W.

description: Nice bar. Dave was a gentleman! Irish white pudding was too die for. No compliamts! Very good!!
author: John D.

description: Very great neighborhood pub. Good food. Lagunitas on tap. That's pretty much all I want in a pub.
author: Sal F.

description: Durty Nelly's has great hearty food, stiff drinks, music, and a friendly crowd. Morning, day and night. Plus walking distance from the house! What more could you ask?
author: Irina S.

description:
Stumbled upon this place on a Saturday afternoon, and at first, we weren't really sure what to make of it. From all the food reviews on Yelp, we thought it'd be a bit like Parkside Tavern (with a bar/restaurant feel). This place is definitely just a bar which happens to serve incredibly baller food. 

It was pretty empty, so we just stood there awkwardly until we were sure it was alright to grab a table. The bartender will come over and take your order when he gets a chance. And then you wait...and you can smell those curry fries before they even hit your table. HOT DAMN, those fries were worth the wait. Sadly, I had to share them with my boyfriend, who was lucky to get a few bites in, I was shoveling them into my mouth so fast. 

We also got some of the traditional pub dishes - bangers & mash, and a full Irish breakfast for me. I could barely move when I was done eating, but I was sooooo satisfied. This is definitely a laid-back, informal environment when it comes to food service, but the food was so awesome I would definitely come back for more.
author: Rachel A.

description: Initially I went to get a haircut at my friend's salon and afterwards went to DN on 10-24-13 8:30pm'sh (since it was nearby, also I was hungry and wanted to sing karaoke).  I ordered a BLTA with fries (the food was surprisingly good, in this instance I did not use ketchup for the fries). Also had lagunitas ipa($5),guiness ($6) and two kamikazes($5 each).   I'm glad they didn't crank up the heat at the fireplace and also the bathroom doesn't stink as bad as before.  When the female bartender increased the volume of the music, the patron beside me told her to lower it----thank god it's not too loud.  Since Kendo was throwing a karaoke gig, that's the primary reason why I'm at this bar.
author: Jer W.

description:
Okay, I have to admit ... if I had not yelped this location there is absolutely positively NO WAY I would have guessed this place was where it is. I mean, I usually go down this section of Irving for boba tea, not a fun Irish bar.

We were pleasantly surprised that we found parking easily. We quickly found out that this place only takes cash, and were even more pleased to find a major bank across the street for ATM access.

We ate before we came, otherwise I would have loved to try the curry chicken. The menu is small but covers all the normal pub food basics.

We also appreciated the true Irish accents in this place.

We all ordered Guinness on tap. Usual price of 5.50.

We were there mid day on a Monday, as that is when we happen to be driving through the city. So as expected it was quiet and relaxing. The service was prompt and friendly. A sure thing to bring us back for many times to come.

One day I'm sure we'll make it for a loud evening, but till then we are quite satisfied with the relaxing experience.
author: Marlene T.

description:
I love this place! I first came here last year right before the Bay To Breakers celebrations with friends and bumped in the owner on my way to the restroom. Reading my sweatshirt that proudly proclaimed "ILLINOIS" he asked what I was doing so far from home. When I told him I was here for a job and my oh my it entails pouring a drink one in awhile, he promptly escorted my ass to the bar.

I LOVE THAT MAN!

I get behind the bar, pour a beer or two, have a shot of peppermint schnapps and leave with a couple phone numbers. My friends look at me from the other side of the bar and just look at me dumbfounded. 

GOOD TIMES ARE HAD HERE...God bless Durty Nellys.
author: Jessica K.

description:
"Sometimes you want to go where everybody knows your name."  Especially if your name begins with Amanda.  Thanks to Manda B. for introducing this place to the SBC.  Our experience was first-rate.... thanks to Brandon.  Cherry bombs were exploding (in a fun way) and the curry fries were rockin.  I tasted their steak burger also and it looks, I mean tastes like I'm going to have to come back for more!  

The few times we stepped foot in this cheery bar, I noticed how cozy yet rowdy this place can be.  I think we took it to another level when the SBC, EB, and SF collided here just recently.  Awesome staff, smooth drinks, good food, and great atmosphere would facilitate my return.  Too bad it's a little too far for me to visit more often.
author: Bobby L.

description:
Aaaaargh.....avast and ahoy there matey!!! I spy Durrrrrrty Nelllllllly's on the horizon. Sorry for the piratitude....I saunter by Durty Nelly's often and a pirate always takes over my brain. An Irish pirate. The crunkest, most smokingest kind. 

I got nothing but love for a place where the guy in charge encourages the invasion of Yelpers from several Bay Area counties, helping to whip them into a frenzy with Cherry Bombs and smiling at 'Manda Bear dancing on the bar. You KNOW the regulars were NOT AMUSED. But I'll bet the cash register was.

Now that I know how nice and cozy and friendly this neighborhood watering hole is I'll stop sliding by and stop in when it's....umm.....quieter.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
A easy to like local pub. The bartender is super Irish and the drinks are affordable. It looks like they have decent pub food, but we only came for drinks.

And like thomas m. says it's really clean, except for maybe the bathroom (and what kind of well-frequented bar has a *clean* bathroom?)

I compare it favorably to The Chieftain in SoMa, except it's much, much cheaper due to its NOT being across the street from the Intercontinental and the Moscone Center.
author: Josh K.

description: Just do yourself a favor and go.  At least once.  Thursday night or a weekend.  Get a beer, enjoy live music and local color.
author: Courtney D.

description: Was meeting friends on a Friday and just chose Durty Nelly's for the convenience of meeting up. The staff were friendly, I enjoyed my cocktails, the food was Irish pub food and good for all that- the prices were reasonable- but truly we happened upon a trivia fundraiser for the Riptide and though we intended to just pitch in and head out- we stayed to the end and had a great time. Glad we ended up there.
author: Kat F.

description:
This is a little warm Irish oasis amid the sea of Asianness in the area. 
Once I walked in, and  my Irish genes fluttered  and woke up a bit, my hair seemed redder and more curly, I could feel all my freckles and desperately wanted a heavy beer. 

It's cozy, warm, they have real fireplace. Most of the other patrons are Irish-like from the homeland- I couldn't understand a lot of what they were saying. 
The menu looked pretty decent and I decided to go with fish & chips with curry fries. 
Decent food. Although, I dont think the Irish palette can make out a very good curry for the fries. It was more like a curry, cumin soup that you dip your fries into. No flare, no spice, no heat. Eh.
author: Tasha A.

description:
If I had a choice to be one person for a day, I would be an Irishman. I would like to drink Irish whiskey, car bombs, and say the word fwuk whenever I damn well please.

I would like to patron a bar like Durty Nelly's and order a pint of beer, while talking with another patron about the local baseball team's chances in the playoffs.

I would like to try the Cherry Bomb, a shot of Absolute Mandarin with a splash of cranberry dropped into a glass of Smirnoff Ice. I would then want to say, "What the fwuk is this girly drink." But I have to admit it does taste pretty good and it does hit the spot!

Of course, I really do not have to be Irish to drink at Durty Nelly's but I'm just saying this for the sake of this review. Also, this bar is located in an Asian strip of the neighborhood. Personally, most of the times I would like to be discreet but some other times, I wouldn't mind being the square peg to the round hole.

That is not a knock on Durty Nelly's. It is a refreshing change of scenery for the area.
author: Sam T.

description: Friendly pub. Bartender was wonderful!   Just will not be back for karaoke.  Got one song in, in 4 hours.  Kareoke guy has a special line for his friends.
author: Daniel A.

description:
I stumbled on Durty Nelly's during one of my dive-bar safaris through the Outer Sunset.  The only problem I have with it? It isn't a dive.  It's actually a *very nice* pub. Management has pulled off a delicate balancing act by making the place clean and tastefully accented, and has done so without sacrificing the authentic, old-world feel that all too often winds up a casualty during a poorly executed pub re-model.

A massive wood map of Ireland graces the East Wall to the rear of the bar.  Artwork that is both tasteful, elegant, and appropriate adorns the other walls.  Particularly intersting are several large scale pencil drawings in the back.  

The patrons here seem to be a pretty reserved lot.  They aren't the rowdy, hard-drinking Irish.  They aren't the bubbly, congenial ones either.  Talk amongst the patrons is quiet and civilized...foul language is rarely if ever heard. Regulars have a tendancy to sit in circles at the bar, making it difficult for strangers to slip into a conversation.  I met an Irish woman later that day that filled me in on the different cultures of Irish drinking establishments.  She told me that Durty Nelly's was "Very Cork".

Nice place.  Cute barmaids.  Authentic, tasteful decor unrivaled by any other pub in the city.  What's not to like?  While all these blessings may appeal to many, the place is a little too smooth around the edges for me.  The insularity of the patrons was a little tighter than I could handle too. It's a nice place, and a great spot to pop into with a date if you're in the hood.  But drop in by yourself, and be prepared to drink alone....
author: Mike W.

description:
Found this place on Yelp, what a great find. Small Irish pub with great food, great bartender and server. Not for the faint of heart or someone easily offended by cursing, but hopefully you wouldn't be in a bar if you were that person!
Great ambience, fun!
author: Suzy G.

description:
Came here for lunch with my Grandparents.  Wasn't even weird.  

The food was so good, way better than I expected.  The french fries are now the spice of my life.  I want to eat them every day.  

The bartender gave my Grandma a shot on the house, and for that reason alone, I will always come back.
author: Rachelle P.

description: I came here a a couple months ago. the food was fine but its smaller than pictures.
author: Gokhan A.

description:
Fantastic new menu!

It doesn't get much better than an evening of banter with the friendly staff and regulars at this neighborhood institution.
author: Megan M.

description: One of my favorite bars in the city! A tiny place with an awesome atmosphere. Staff and patrons are funny and friendly. Thursday night karaoke sessions are spirited and so welcoming. Every time I visit Durty Nelly's it is a night to remember.
author: Jasmine M.

description: Really durty nelly's? Me and my friends were at Golden Gate Park and wanted a nice beer to end our lovely day. We came to durty Nelly's because it was close by and had good reviews on yelp. But wow. I ordered four Stella's on draft for my group (which by the way tasted pretty damn flat), and we also ordered two baskets of regular old fries. I paid for the beers and we sat at a table.  ( my friend was going to pay for the fries and possibly get another round on his tab) Started talking, and soon enough 30 minutes had passed by with NO FRIES. Are you kidding me? fries take at most 3 minutes to cook. We started to look towards the bartender who was periodically leaving the bar to sit at a table herself with some friends, completely ignorant of the fact that we had yet to receive our food. She even was taking shots with the Irish men at the bar. To top it off the cook had served other people their food and was standing by the bar, either on her phone or watching one of the TVs. Either they completely forgot we ordered food or the service is horrible or both. The place was gross, table was sticky, bathroom was horrendous ( and it was only 445, 5, not late at night. Booth cushions were ripped and quite old. The place looks like the name tells.. it's dirty and a bad service Irish Pub. I will never be back Durty Nelly's.
author: Kevin G.

description: Great authentic Irish bar in Outer Sunset. My friends and I just ate there and all agree it has to best Irish breakfast, hands down, in the city. Dan is an amazing chef.. Bartenders top notch. Great local bar. Check it out.
author: Lisa K.

description: This is a rather standard Irish pub. They have all of the beers one would expect (and nothing else). I decided to pass on the food as everything that was ordered at my table looked unimpressive. The quizzo took forever and we ended up winning a round of drinks, by the time we were done I was in no mood for another round and we ended up giving our prize to another table. I think there are better bars to go to close by and I'd rather go check out one of those.
author: Stephen S.

description:
I love this place.  It's the closest bar to my house and I wouldn't trade it for any of the other bars in the inner or outer sunset.

It's a full Irish bar that's full of Irish people, seriously!  I've been in there on nights where the place is packed and I'm the only person with an American accent.  That being said, I've always felt welcome and the bar staff is really friendly and cool.

I've tried the Irish breakfast, Cheeseburger, Curry Fries, and Fish and Chips here.  All were excellent.  My two faves are the Irish Breakfast and Cheeseburger (weird, right?) tho.  The Curry Fries are awesome to share at a table.  It's that thicker brown curry over thick steak fries... yum.

You can wash it all down with a good selection of whiskeys or beer on tap.

I think  Smithwicks and Cheeseburger w/ fries cost me about 13-15 dollars and was worth every penny.
author: Joseph H.

description: \basically judge a place (bar or restaurant) based on their restrooms.. cuz nothing is worse than a good restaurant with a bad restroom. This place has a great restroom..it was a pleasant surprise. Live music was good here too!:)
author: Carla C.

description:
Best burger in the outer sunset hands down. 

can place an order for pick up so you don't always have to eat in a bar environment. 

their grilled chicken sandwich is really good if your trying to watch what you're eating. 

Service is a hit or miss depending on when you go and most times you have to order  at the bar. Kind of confusing sometimes.
author: Cristina S.

description:
I love this bar and I lust the bartenders!

Why do Irishmen have so much charm?  I know they just tell you what you want to hear, but I am OK with that because they do it with an accent and a wink.

On to the actual review.  This is the kind of bar you can go to all day everyday  and never have to leave.  They serve food and drinks and what else besides air do you need?  Nothing.  Exactly.  So, I went with a girlfriend and we sat at the bar and ordered some Magners and fries.  We sat and talked to Rauiri (bartender) and he was fun.
