Then, he got off work (we were there THAT long), and his cousin Odhran came in as the next bartender.   I lust Odie so much, but unfortunately I spotted a wedding ring after about 2 minutes.  Wedding ring means I can't take him home with me, but doesn't mean I can't be friendly and gaze at him longingly!  

I am pretty sure that my friend and I were the only 2 in the bar who were not Irish.  All the people in the bar are super friendly and most are super Irish.  So many regulars come in throughout the day/evening and although I have never been to Ireland, I consider this the closest I have been.   I live in low pac heights, so it isn't exactly my neighborhood bar, but they always have parking and it is totally worth going to!

Great drinks
Great bartenders
Great prices
Great bartenders
Great fries
Great bartenders
Great regulars
Great bartenders
Great parking
Great bartenders
Great music (live, ipod, and jukebox)
Great fun!!!  Oh, and I almost forgot...great bartenders! 
I'll be back, probably this week, and next, and the following, etc, etc.
author: M M.

description: Bartender working right now is very rude and offensive. I walked in and get no acknowledgement. Being the ONLY female in there I would have that a would have stock out. I ordered a burger through one the people dropping off the food because by now I had been there 15 minutes with no recognition. I ordered a bacon cheese burger med rare. 25 minutes later which I thought was strange seeing as there was no other food coming out of the kitchen so why should it takes a med rare burger to come out of the kitchen, I receive my burger. At this point I am so starving I'm beginning to start drooling of the thoughts of food. I byte into the center of my burger. Dry and well done. Oh noooooo. It's not often I send back food but over cooked beef is a deal breaker. I finally flag down the bartender who then makes me feel very uncomfortable and not welcome.  But I understand how she might value her male customers but I am a paying customer. Showed her the over cooked burger. She then responds condescendingly "so do you want him to make u another one". I have been serving/ bartending for the pat 10 years. And u shouldn't make your customer feel uncomfortable or judged because my burger is over cooked. I say yes but ask if I can keep my fries because at this point I wanna grab a snack box from quicklys while I wait another 25 min for my refired burger.  She just gives me a look and then takes the whole plate, fries and all  about 15 min later the chef comes out and asks what was wrong with the burger.....WHAT?! you havent even started making it yet?  how difficult is it to get a well-cooked burger around here?!  i then ask him as i hear my stomach start to growl if he would bring me back the fries, which he did, which were now cold and gross.  The burger came out about 15 min later and was cooked correctly.  This whole time i have not been offered a water or other beverage.  The only time the bartender came over was to hand me my check and rushed me to pay her,  i was int he middle of put the money on the bar when she scoops it up when i hadnt even paid in full  I dont remember the last time i felt so unwelcome and offended by someone that works in a restaurant, i mean this is my industry, these are my people, but not this place  i will not return
author: Lizz M.

description:
I was looking through Yelp for places to eat at when I was on vacation in San Francisco and Durty Nelly's caught my eye. How can a 4.5 star pub be bad? This place exceeded my expectations. It's an Irish pub and the people working there are Irish (which is nice to see). The food was pretty good. I got fish and chips and I liked that they gave me limes instead of lemons, just something a little different. 

When one of the bartenders brought our food over, she accidentally knocked over one of our beers which spilled all over my friend. She apologized and brought over a new beer and offered us all cherry bombs on the house.

The bartenders are all really friendly and their Irish accents didn't hurt either. One of the regulars came by our table often and told us jokes and to tell us random things. I enjoyed coming here and will be back the next time i'm in SF and want to go to a pub.
author: Tina M.

description:
Great food, great beer! I wish there were more servers to assist the bartenders- staff is very friendly and helpful :) but you usually have to go to the bar to pick up menus and on a busy night it may take a while for your order to be placed.  
I've had the Fish and Chips and Nelly's Burger- I highly recommend them both!!   YOU MUST TRY THEIR (non traditional) AIOLI SAUCE!!!!  I am not a mayo fan, but their (non traditional) aioli has won me over on their fries and burgers!!
author: Bobby P.

description: Lots of fun. The staff was a lot of fun but the locals ranged from really great to kinda weird (not in a good way). Cash only.
author: Lance C.

description:
I just moved to the neighborhood and I've been trying to find a bar that I can feel like I can just hang out at. I've been to a few around the area, but none that seemed to have that "homey" feel; then I walked into Durty Nelly's.

I love this bar. The bartender is very friendly and the people that hang out there seem to be regulars. I like that. The crowd seems to be a vast collection; there were kids, twenty-somethings, and people 40 and up. Everyone seemed to be having a good time.

I have only had one meal there, but I definitely plan on going back to try the others! My meal was great; but I don't think anyone can screw up a grilled cheese sandwich.

Check it out! The beer is cold, the meals are hot, and the atmosphere is thriving. I've found my new hangout spot!
author: Angie P.

description:
Its fine for a bar. We tried the curry fries which were inoffensive. I think ordering food from the bar tender is a little awkward. I wouldn't come back to eat, just to drink.

It feels like Ireland in there: men in soccer shorts.
author: Catt G.

description: Very fun. They have a juke box so you can pick what you want to listen too. Well priced drinks. Bartenders are very friendly and personable.
author: Jena D.

description: Was pleasantly surprised by my first visit to this local pub. Great laid back atmosphere and good food. Had to wait awhile for a place to sit, but glad I staued. Will be back soon!
author: Nichole F.

description: Yelpers, you are not wrong.  The burger and fries are absolutely stellar!  I only popped in for food so I can't really comment much on the ambiance, but the service was friendly and prompt.  And that burger...  mmmmmm...  I can't wait to go back and have another one.
author: Lorelei S.

description:
Worth every star and more. I'd give it six if I could. The fries are always perfectly crispy. The burgers, when ordered rare, actually arrive RARE! I don't mean pinkish in the middle. I mean soft, red, cool and bloody, the way meat is meant to be served. If that's not your thing, they will cook to order and ACTUALLY GET IT RIGHT!!!!!

I have never had a bad experience here, and I go often. The aïoli is phenomenal. The curry is perfectly spiced. The shepherd's pie is fantastic. The full Irish breakfast is more than filling. 

What's more, the menu just expanded to include all your Irish favorites! These are real family recipes made the way they were meant to be. The entire menu is no-fail. Beer-battered sausages, fried garlic mushrooms, beef and Guinness stew! Wash it down with a beverage, strike up a conversation, and find a complimentary cherry bomb next to your empty plate.

This is the most generous staff I've encountered in San Francisco. They have the best food, two screens where I can usually catch soccer highlights or sports playoffs, and -- the best part -- completely absent is the ubiquitous SF look-at-me douchebag. This is the place where you walk in the door and feel at home. Five, six, seven. Give me more stars so I can dish 'em out!

THE BEST SPOT IN SF FOR FOOD OR DRINKS.
author: Nick W.

description:
needed a place to hang out after the yearly fam dinner (moon cake festival) for some etoh. sunday night. gf and i did not have work the following day. so wine or beer. it didn't matter. of course, used our handy dandy yelp app for the surrounding area and Durty Nelly's pops up on the top search for multiple entries. 

i loved it. an irish bar with an actual irish bartender (who is also the owner) and irish patrons.  odie was really sweet and so was one of his regulars, D. everyone there was just relaxing and having a good time. sportsy stuff was playing on the multiple flat screens, not sure if anyone was paying attention to that cuz i sure wasn't. drank dudes were belting out tunes from the juke box. seating is at the bar or booths on the opposite side of the room, but everyone was at the bar. a pretty chilled spot.

we both enjoyed a few things of blue moons. and odie introduced a brandy-cherry-7up shot to us. damn, it was yummy. was introduced to a few other things that weren't so yummy- some licorice shot, and some very dark irish beer. yeee... but we live and learn. 

definitely will be returning. and when we do, i'm gonna get there earlier so we can get our chow on. simply cannot wait.
author: Uliej O.

description: This is a great bar! Great food, bartenders/staff, interesting and fun clientele, and a very cozy ambiance. They always seem to have the fireplace going when I go, which I love!
author: Jennifer M.

description: I love this place! so much fun and tons of Outer Sunset craziness.  Bartender are super nice and friendly, and there's always a riot of laughter here.
author: Mel H.

description: Great bar with awesome bartenders! I've been here a few times and have never had a bad time.  Good for watching 49ers and/or Giants games or just for having a fun night out with friends.  And the fries here are amazing, just saying.
author: Eric L.

description: It's a dive-ish bar, but it's pretty nice. Friendly, and comfortable. Gets packed really quickly. The right kind of irish carbomb. shot of Jameson, touch of bailey's, dunked into half a glass of Guinness. Fastest and tastiest way to inebriation.
author: Raymond H.

description:
Cozy little spot that made me feel like I was in Cork. It seemed like everyone had an Irish accent and I had a fun time playing pub trivia with the locals. 

Don't recall the beer selection because once I saw Smithwick's on tap I was done looking for the night. 

I heard great things about the food here but I had the fish & chips and it was not good at all. Tasted like something you could find in the frozen section at Safeway. Fries were okay. 

I would give this place another shot if I lived close by, but I don't so I probably will not be back. If you stroll by and feel like kicking back to watch some soccer, check it out.
author: Michael C.

description: Friendly Cheers atmosphere & yummy food . Just enjoyed a great $9 beer marinated Italian sausage sandwich with a huge mound of excellent fries ( the kind with the skin still on, my fave). Roll was soft & warm, grilled onions& peppers were melting& sausage was full of beer flavor & juicy. johnny Cash on the jukebox, anthony Bourdain's No Reservations on the TV & other bar patrons laughing appreciatively, easy street parking & a sunny day = one of the nicest afternoons ever.  A great place to hang out.  Plus the BEST Goodwill is just one block down.
author: Karen C.

description: Ah yes Durty Nelly's!  They have some awesome people inside and the atmosphere is nice.  I have yet to try the food here but I bet it's worth a shot.  I'll write another review, but based on my experience with this bar so far, I love the deals they have and the bartender was very friendly.  The people here are very friendly as well so the overall culture of Durty Nelly's is quite pleasant.  It may just as well be the Blarney Stone of Outer Sunset.
author: Sam K.

description:
+ The bangers and mash were the bomb.

+ The bartenders were friendly and no one flinched when I ordered a soda (Call me crazy, but I prefer not to drink and drive while borrowing my friends car.)

+ They seem to have some kind of satellite/cable 24 hour soccer channel hookup.

+ Everyone sounded Irish, which of course lends itself to the authenticity of the Irish Pub.

+ Someone actually came up to the bar next to me, handed the bartender $15 and said, "This is for the other night, I was so gone when I left here I forgot to tip you." After all, the least acknowledged factor that makes a decent place are the patrons, and that clinched it for me.
author: Gabe S.

description:
2 Pints Magners down in my tummy
 1 mandarin vodka and Soda
 1 cherry bomb on the house!
 Bangers and Mash
 curry fries
 and a bite of chicken pot pie. 
Alcohol was fab of course! haha
Bangers were real good, don't expect a large sausage it's like 5 little breakfast sausage size ones but VERY tasty! MASH- uhh ok not awsome.
Curry Fries- I don't like
Chicken Pot Pie- Stay the hell away from this thing! Horrible! Tasted like left over chicken mixed with lots of peas and it was all stuck together with dried up sauce, it was BAD!
Bartender- Awsome! and cute but married haha. 
Place- relaxed and cool
People- Casual and nice mixture old and young.
author: Karen T.

description:
Nice in the afternoon when it's not too crowded.  Authentic-style pub.  Plus for food, booths, and bar. Minus for having only one stout on tap.

Will have to return to sample whiskey...
author: Ken B.

description: I moved away from the Sunset years ago but I miss this place. I spent two happy New Years there. The food is excellent. However, the thing I miss the most are the cherry bombs! I am a no sugar and frills, gin/beer kind of girl (I also dislike vodka and Smirnoff ice), but my goodness, the cherry bombs are GREAT, when made correctly by staff (usually Brandon).
author: Melissa A.

description: Love love LOVE this place!!! Great food, generous drinks, fun bartenders. Enter a stranger....leave a friend ;)
author: Cyd P.

description: Came here randomly on a walk to the bus today, and I'm so glad we did. The bartender was super sweet and the other patrons were all very friendly locals. We only had time for one drink, and ordered Jameson and gingers. They were made perfectly. We spent about a half hour drinking our drinks and had a great time. I'm sad we weren't able to stay longer, and I look forward to coming back to try the food sometime soon.
author: Lauren D.

description: I love this place. Laid back, and everyone is so nice. We got served instantly and the drinks were decently priced. I think that it can be one of our new hang outs :)
author: Kristin S.

description:
I like Irish pubs, probably because I like Irish men. (It's more of a love/ hate thing really). In some ways, Durty Nelly's is a more than decent Irish pub. The building is cute, the atmosphere is relaxed, and the bathroom isn't disgusting. But something weird happened when I was there. The music switched from cheesy 80s (which I like) to country-ish. Everyone spontaneously got up and began pseudo-square dancing at a frenetic pace. It was as if everyone was vying to be the craziest, quirkiest dancer. I really didn't understand. Is this what always happens at Durty Nelly's on a Friday night? Also, I don't expect people to be dressed to the nines to go to a pub, but I also didn't expect to see people under 35 wearing either a sweats/pyjama top/ flannel shirt combo or jeans that were manufactured sometime before Wham! broke up.

There were also the smells, but I'll give Durty Nelly's the benefit of the doubt and just blame that on some customers with some hygiene/ digestive issues.
author: Susan S.

description: Great place! My local go-to bar in the neighborhood, and they make great burgers and fries at lunch. I'm a fan of the small but homey fireplace on those foggy days in the sunset.  Best of all-  the warm, unpretentious, homey vibe of the place, with great staff who recognize regulars and are super friendly with everyone.
author: Maile H.

description:
Durty Nelly's will always have a special place in my heart - I met my husband here! 

A tall, dark Irishman and I met eyes across the bar! 8 years later, two kids (and a dog) we are still happily married.
author: C L.

description: There really is NO BETTER Irish Pub in San Francisco!
author: Cyd K.

description: I've walked past Durty Nelly's probably hundreds of times in my life and I never thought I would set foot in here. It was a Saturday night and my friend from out of town wanted to pay a visit to Durty Nelly's since he enjoyed it the last time he was there. It's pretty dark inside and from my recollection, decorated with a lot of wood. There was a live guitarist there that night. He sang so loudly that it was difficult to maintain any sort of conversation. I had a cranberry vodka, which was on the small side, but strong and cheap ($5). Not really my crowd, but I wouldn't mind going back..on the guitarist's nights off.
author: Audrey T.

description:
This place is an awesome chill & hang out bar.  It gets super crowded some nights if you're into that sort of thing.  Bartenders are friendly and great.    Food is good  too--especially their burgers.
Less typing more drinking...
author: Billy C.

description: Cozy atmosphere and good service. One of the better Irish bars in the Sunset.
author: Patrick S.

description:
I went here with a good friend, an Irishman of some repute.  We both liked the ambience although he would have preferred some more wood panelling, I guess that's an Irish thing.  The drinks were good and the staff friendly and pleasingly Irish, plenty of brogues going around which was enjoyable even for someone of German heritage such as myself.  

The only problem was they started doing trivia night on the Wednesday we went, which I found annoying since we just wanted to chill and have some ale.  Our own fault for going that night, should have read ahead.  I look forward to going back on some quieter night.
author: Alan S.

description: Legit little place. The food and drinks are cheap, the vibe is good, and real Irish people work there. I ordered an insane ham and cheese sandwich and fries for like $7. Stop in, it's a nice local place, highly recommend. Not sure the nighttime vibe, but I was there in the afternoon and it was relaxed (I'm told it gets a little wild when the sun goes down)
author: Brandon D.

description:
Must say I love the feel of this place, I find it cozy. I had a great experience here a few days back with a very friendly bar tender. Made me feel like a regular even though it was only my second visit.
Place was clean, bar staff were very professional & I felt comfortable here.
I'm sure when I'm in that area again I will pop by for a beverage or two.
author: Jennifer R.

description: I had such an great time here when I last visited SF! It's a small, cozy place full of locals and true alkies ;-) Had some locals buy us a round of drinks, danced with a cute guy I met there and met some really awesome people. Such a fun night!!!
author: Anna N.

description:
I have found my new favorite watering hole. 
From the moment me and my buddy walked up, the bartender was outside smoking and made us feel very welcome! I, being half-Irish myself, found it comforting to see and ACTUAL Irish pub, vs a douchey sports bar with Guinness signs and clovers.
The BLT I had was great. They take their time pouring your beer, like it should be, and the atmosphere was great.
Big plus for having a great guy/girl ratio as well! 
'Erin Go Braugh!'
author: David M.

description: We love this place, super friendly staff, delicious food, fun, convivial atmosphere. Totally made us feel welcome in our new neighborhood.
author: David B.

description:
I have been eating and shopping at places on Irving since I could walk, and I never gave this place a second glace other than to admire their colorful seasonal and sports-affiliated flags hanging outside.  This has changed since I turned of age.

Laid-back, no pretense, comfortable vibe, Gigantes were on the screen, delicious fish n' chips.  Charming, friendly and helpful bartenders who suggested we try the Magners cider (refreshing.  mmm.)  Left happy, full, and with that warm fuzzy feeling I get after watching a favorite team with other fans, Or after other things.
author: Jaclyn L.

description:
This place is so cool
When you come in you understand what is a real Irish pub and they have great food like the Irish breakfast and the cheeseburger 
The stuff are really nice and every time I go there I feel so welcome like is my own place
Also the people that come there are really nice so it's make it even better
So if you want to go to a great Irish pub go there and I promise you that you will enjoy
author: Boaz H.

description:
This is probably the closest you'll get to an Irish Pub without actually flying across the Atlantic. This ain't no touristy downtown pub with $6 pints of Guiness and $15 fish and chips. There are actual Irish expats tending the bar, Magners on draft, cheap and delicious eats and occasional live music. If you're lucky you'll stumble in when a local old dude is celebrating his 80th birthday, dancing adorably with his smiling wife (and every other girl in the place) and playing the harmonica.
The menu here is limited, but everything is tasty. Did I mention that I've never once paid for their signature cherry bomb?
author: Melanie V.

description: I've been here a couple times when in the area, and I had a surprisingly good beef sandwich one time for lunch.  The blonde bartender is friendly, but... I hate to say this, her service lacks.  She does a good job of chatting up the numerous local regulars, but both times I was there I would go 20 minutes or more during which she was engrossed in a conversation and not even checking to see if I needed another drink or whatnot.  I don't expect nor want conversation, but I also don't want to wave my arms or have go to over there to flag someone down for a drink... While I'm already sitting at the bar with a long empty glass in front of me.  So as much as this place is decent in other ways, I have to give the service a pass.
author: Dave N.

description:
Guys, guys. There is nothing 5 stars about this place. A handful of beers on tap, a few booths and 2 tables. Two very small, highly reflective screens for ESPN, and that's it.
The food is just plain awful, and uncooked. Floppy fries, boiled bacon... Just don't eat here.
author: Carlo M.

description:
I was born and raised in Northern Co. Kerry. As a kid I loved the opportunity to go to Shannon airport to pick up or drop off a relative or friend. Not because I like airports you eejit, but because it meant we could go to Durty Nelly's six miles outside the airport. What a great place to eat and drink.

Lo and behold when I heard of an Irish bar in SF of the same name, sure I had to go and check it out. What a treat to find such a warm, welcoming little pub in our often too hectic city.  I have been to just about all the Irish pubs here and none compare to Durty Nelly's.  While I can find something positive to say about all the other places, only Durty Nelly's can transport me home for a brief respite. 

I don't say that lightly, and to be honest I would rather be there now than writing this stupid review.  I went to the pub last month and returned there tonight.  The barman, Brandon is quite the Irishman and a great character. He was attentive, funny and professional.  It is quite obvious he loves his job and that is one of the most important factors in having a successful business.  He was running around doing a hundred things at once, all of it seamlessly. Kudos to you sir.  

But wait, there is more..........

....... Bacon and Cabbage!      Thank you Jesus for Daniel and his culinary talents.  I don't mean the corned beef garbage often passed of as bacon and cabbage here in the U.S.    I mean real cured back bacon just like my mother made every Saturday for dinner in Listowel, while we all waiting for dad to come up from the pub.  Absolutely delicious.  Thank you Daniel for going to all the trouble of curing the bacon and offering it on the menu as a special. What a nice guy to talk to as well.  

You should call to see when it is being served next, and then go get a nice piece of bacon and a real taste of Ireland at Durty Nelly's.  My friends ate the fish & chips & BLT, they loved their meals and said they would order them again. The menu is short and sweet, just perfect. We had a great time here again.

I am not going to describe the interior, furnishings, fireplace and all the other trimmings because they are unimportant in the grand scheme of things.  Anybody who knows Ireland or an Irish person will understand that it is the people who make a place and you will find the spirit of our great country right here in this little pub.

So if you are looking for a real Irish bar with real Irish food head over to Durty Nelly's. If you are looking for a fake, glossed over, stage version of an Irish bar then go downtown SF or perhaps back to the Marina.    
Go raibh  maith agat!
author: Cheeky Monkey A.

description: The first time I was at Durty Nelley's I watched Cody Ross "Cody Ross" the Phillies in the NLCS.  Once the bar erupted in Guinness soaked adulation, I knew I'd picked a winner.  My only gripe is that their cash-only rules frequently end up "Cody Rossing" me.
author: Michael D.

description: It's a pub! With amazing burgers and fries and a nice vibe. It's cash only
author: Monica D.

description:
Great hole-in-the-wall. Love the real Irish accents.

I apologize about the public showing. I really am no exhibitionist.

*shakes head disapprovingly*
author: Andrew F.

description:
Durrty Nellys is a awesome little Irish Bar/Pub or whatever you would like to call it. 

Ended up here after an UYE and since I was late I needed to catch a bite to eat here too. First off the place is small but not too small, the set up is intimate but if you pull back the booth curtains you can make it more conversational. The decor is typical of an irish bar but the part I love the best was that it came complete with Irish accents as well!!! WIN.

Food - I ordered fish and chips and they were spot on...not too greasy but maybe that is because all the grease leaked out the bottom of my basket LOL...

The Bartenders are friendly and attentive and the drinks are well made, they dont hold on the liquor. 

Overall definitely a place Ill go back to!!!
author: Sheila C.

description:
What do you say when you leave this place??
Top of the morning to ya.... cuz once you get there, you don't want to leave till you close it down in the morning. 

I would like to pay homage to Brandon the barkeep. Brandon my cherry bomb makin, cider pouring, last minute food takin Irishman..... if you don't know him then you don't know Durty Nelly's. 
BTW- do you now Michael H? XD

Where else can you get a great medium rare steak sandwich and curry chips in the predominantly chinese neighborhood while listening to Irish acoustics in a throng of yelpers where Amanda is downing cherry bombs like it's going out of fashion.  Here, that's where! And don't forget that in the wee (lil) mens bathroom it is normal to find three grown ass men sharing the space of a closet.
Odd, I don't remember leaving....
author: John-Michael C.

description: Good spot. Served both our food dishes differently to what the menu said. (chicken pot pie, and ny steak)
author: Barry G.

description:
Not sure what we did wrong, but my husband and I moved to the neighborhood 6 months ago, tried DN's 3 or 4 times and couldn't get a smile or a drink. 
The bartender ignored us. It seemed like you had to be a regular to get service. 

We are friendly and good tippers. 

It's disappointing because there are so many positive reviews. 

We gave up trying and won't go back.
author: Theresa M.

description:
Holy! This is the best french fries I ever had! Tasty and all freshly made.
Also they have Chicken Curry Fries which also was pretty unique. 
The hamburger looks amazing but I haven't had the chance to try it out. 

I'm glad to see an Irish Pub in the middle of an Asian-dominated area can pull out food this good and not just pushing out beer and liquor like most pubs I have ever been to.

I came here with several Yelpers, parking could be a problem since this street is filled with old restaurants and banks with no parking structures around, most places in the streets are typical SF homes so either park a block away or so. We managed to get one in front of Coco's Crawfish which is just in front of the pub. 

Now I'm not much of a beer or liquor drinker (long story) so I only go for white or red wine and usually some people will look at you in a funny way if you order wine, but Brandon who was behind the bar just pulled out a chilled bottle of Chardonnay and filled my glass every time I hung back at the bar. Three cheers for Brandon! I believe he's known for the Cherry Bomb drinks that Amanda B ordered for all the ladies in our group.

I rarely go to SF for drinks but this place makes me want to come back.....


As long as someone drives me back if I get tipsy. :D

So uh... who's Nelly ?
author: Dennis O.

description:
Brandon is one of those 6'2" Irish guys that you need in your neighbor community - cool, funny, has great stories, lived in Hawaii, knows all the locals, the locals know him, makes the best Cherry Bombs and Irish Coffee, and looks like he'll bail you out off an Asian street brawl.    

Tonight the Brotherhood had a chance to drink up with Brandon and enjoy his Irish Pub in the middle of Asian town's Irving Street.    We shared our plans for next week's event and has agreed to collaborate with us on the first ever SBC and SF UYE! 

Yes... its OFFICIAL - Friday, December 5th, 2008 in San Francisco!

UYE Collision Course:  SBC & SF at Durty Nelly's!!!
http://www.yelp.com/events/san-francisco-uye-collision-course-sbc-and-sf-yelp-at-durty-nellys
author: Walter P.

description:
Came here for Manda bear's UYE party after eating at Coco's craw fish. I came here a few times with my buddy James c back in the day when he ran So restaurant, the original San Tung on 24th and Irving. Brought back memories. Shots of hennessey and coke backs after having lunch at So's was no joke. 

I came here two Fridays ago. I actually had the food here as well because we were still a little hungry after all of that drinking at Coco's. Brandan did a great job of hosting the bar and it was packed. They had a live band there as well and they were great. I am very impressed with their menu. It can get a little stuffy in there. I would actually come back here for the food and a pint. This place makes me want to drink beer.
author: jason g.

description:
Let's see Chinese joint, Chinese joint, Chinese joint, Nelly's.  Not being from this area and fearing the parking situation, I parked a few blocks down, so got a lay of the land.

First thing I do is order a couple of pints and ask for a menu.  I hear the kitchen is closed, but they still hook me up with fries.  That's cool.  I would have understood if they didn't try, but Brandon made the effort.  Which is good, since I was rolling in on an empty stomach, wasn't sure the Guiness would be enough to feed me without turning me piss drunk assaholic.

Props to the guy singing everything from Beastie Boys and Outkast to Violent Femmes and Talking Heads and just about anything in between.

Outside we were talking to Brandon, Elvis, the Phantom and a guy telling dirty jokes steeped in an Irish accent, would that be called brogue?

The lady outside who unwittingly got caught up in this was pretty offended, which was kinda awesome.
author: Ed H.

description:
A nice place to spend a quiet weekday afternoon with a Guinness, while contemplating thoughts that have no place within such walls: 

-How the slightly cracked window let in a refreshingly cool breeze, felt only on the most laid-back of days.

-How the incoming sunlight lit the weathered bar, softly accentuating the wood stripped after years of loving abuse.

-How I was able to use a bathroom twice without having to pretend to rent something from Blockbuster.
author: Keane L.

description:
One time, at band camp.....

yes, I went to band camp, and outdoor adventure camp, and art camp, and church camp, and this strange camp where we learned to shoot things like rifles and slingshots and bow and arrows...but anyhow, this is about band camp. It is, in no way, about how my parents thought it a good idea to send their kid off to learn to shoot guns in order to have some peace and quiet every summer. No it is about band camp. No, wait, it is about Durty Nelly's......but whatever! 

Though church camp would appear to be the logical first choice for worst experience, it comes in second to band camp. The reason being the people I was surrounded by, who relentlessly teased me for "being where I don't belong" and actually going to a camp to play flute, when clearly I had no fucking idea what I was doing. As if this was my choice. I should have brought my violin....but I hadn't started playing it yet, so I guess that would have been just as bad. 

We had a camp counselor who was a drunk, who would sneak out of our tent at night to drink with the boy counselors, and who had a general disdain for us campers. Since my fellow campers had a general disdain for me as well, it was a fun summer all around. Which brings me to the clientele at Durty Nelly's.

Last time I was here (interject useful part of review) at this somewhat run down, dark wood, occasional DJ in the corner, average priced, Guinness and Magners heavy, often crowded bar with some booth seating, I heard someone talking about the awful time she had as a camp counselor. She was drunk, she was surrounded by boys. She reminded me of my counselor. Had she been 10 years older, and not Irish, I would have thought she was my counselor back in 82, or whenever it was I was subjected to the hell of band camp. She may have been my counselors younger Irish sister...maybe.

In addition, I am pretty sure that my fellow campers at "Camp Nelly's" had the same disdain for me as my former camp pals. I assume this because they made comments to the effect of me "being where I don't belong". This time it wasn't about my lack of musical talent though, it was about my being American. Strange, I thought California was in America. But, I also thought it was okay to try to learn an instrument at band camp. What do I know!!!??
author: Drue C.

description: Really cool local place. I stopped by for a single beer and ended up spending a few hours. If I lived by here I would be here everyday. Awesome bartender and good music.
author: Robert I.

description:
Robbie with the ZX-9, served us. I don't remember much more after having 3 cherry bombs.

What does Durty Nelly's mean? Is it like a Dirty Sanchez?

Bob's your uncle.
author: Kevo M.

description:
Decent Irish pub with REALLY GREAT curry fries. Wow.. 

But the beer selection SUCKS.
author: Jen D.

description:
Great place to hang out on Irvine.  

Lots of neighborhood regulars, who didn't seem to mind the Yelp invasion from SF, East Bay, and South Bay.  Thank you regulars!

Not a particularly large bar, the kitchen was sadly closed by the time we got there.  They did still have curry sauced fries available, and these were just fantastic.  

As an Irish bar, my biggest disappointment was that there was no Middleton, a whiskey some would say is the best that Ireland has to offer.  They did have some Scottish whiskeys available, but not Talisker or Cardhu or Craggenmore or Oban.  Oh well.  

The bar is fairly small, but has a great vibe, and Brandon and the other bartenders were exceptionally attentive and fast until the final invasion crew doubled the number of folks in the bar.

It may be against some sort of city code, but a few chairs and tiny coffee tables would have been a nice touch, especially to get out of the sardine crowd in the bar for a bit.  But it was all good.

Will I be back again?  Definitely.  But since I won't be back often because of the distance, it's hard to give a perfect score.  Couple with the lack of several whiskeys I like, this place gets a solid 4.

You know what that means, right...Yay!  I'm a fan!
author: Tetsu N.

description:
What a night?!! All I remember was meeting this awesome girl and drinking heavily. 

It was after all St. Patricks Day. 

The drinks, the music, the dancing that took place almost everywhere in the bar, and the sticking floor from all those bottle spills made the night memorable. Probably one of the best St. Patty's day, I've experience. 

In the end, an Irish Bar wouldn't be an Irish bar without a fight. Yup, a fight....no surprise. And yours truly Stanley K went home lucky.
author: Stanley K.

description:
Had a great time here and the place is rocking! I loved the music, atmosphere and of course good beer and jameson. I tried the curry chips and really loved them and my mate wants to go back next weekend
which we are. The bartender and the patrons were so sweet to us and fun and the prices are right!
author: Nadia N.

description:
Going to Durty Nelly's on Saturday night made me feel like I was in one of my favorite movies "Shaun of the Dead".

Remember that scene in which Shaun and Ed find a girl in the garden, and they think she's drunk, but she's actually a zombie?  Shaun pushes her hard and she gets impaled on a steel pole, but then she gets up and starts walking towards them again, while Shaun and Ed stare at her wide-eyed.  

That's what the drunk people are like at Durty Nelly's.  It's absolutely hilarious to watch.  I saw two people nearly pass out, and then five minutes later they were ordering another drink.  Incredible!   One girl saved herself from hitting the floor by holding on to my purse.  I couldn't move, and she didn't move for about 10 minutes until her friend grabbed her by her waist and propped her up on a stool.  Time for another pint!

The bartenders here are excellent - I have never seen drinks poured this well or this fast.  They are working so hard, there is no time to clear the bottles - it's like that game "100 Bottles of Beer on the Wall" but they are on the tables and bar.  The bouncers have their hands full with the  people who do cross the line (but some of them make their way back in...just like those zombies, you can't keep 'em down!).  Really, though, everyone here is just fun-loving and harmless and there to have a good time.

At one point, some folks were standing on one of the tables, and the bartender just threw a towel at them to tell them to get down.  It was awesome - like disciplining animals.  And it reminded me of this scene, where Shaun and Ed are throwing old albums at the zombies:

Ed: "Purple Rain"?
Shaun: No.
Ed: "Sign o' the Times"?
Shaun: Definitely not.
Ed: The "Batman" soundtrack?
Shaun: Throw it. 

Well, unlike our heroes in the film, we were bitten and soon participating in the rowdiness all around us.  There is nothing more fun than an entire bar singing along to a live rendition of "Dirty Old Town".  Young and old, male and female, arms around each other and singing their hearts out, present company included.

Ohhh, that was fun.  But through the mayhem, I also recognize a great bar when I find it, and I  will definitely be back during a more quiet time to enjoy a creamy Guinness and some pub grub.  

I'll leave you with this bit of wisdom:

Shaun: As Bertrand Russell once said, "The only thing that will redeem mankind is cooperation." I think we can all appreciate the relevance of that now.
Liz: Was that on a beer mat?
Shaun: Yeah, it was Guinness Extra Cold.
Liz: I won't say anything.
Shaun: Thanks

If the world is ending, I am going to make a beeline for Durty Nelly's.  Because when it comes down to it, all you really need is a pint, your friends, and some good music.  And perhaps a little bit of wisdom thrown in.  Good times.
author: Liz S.

description:
I came here during my lunch break because i was hungry and depressed about my work life being bleak. Stormiest day ever. Saw that it had food and beer, so I was sold.

Honestly, the people in here are amazing. I ended up getting wasted from cherry bomb after cherry bomb, not going back to work, and wondering how I got home. I literally wrote in my notebook "i love this place and going to sleep with this bar and everyone in it, including the girls." Robbie also let me smoke a cig out the back so I wouldnt get pelted by the storm. I think it's true love.

If you loooove cherry bombs, irish accents, or all around really welcoming friendly people (or are a youngish blonde chick by herself), go. You'll love it, until you realize you've left your computer at work and your car is stil parked in the boondocks the next morning.
author: Kristen H.

description: The lamb burger is awesome! The regular burger is awesome! The shepperd's pie is OK. This bar has an easy, feel-good ambiance. It's not too big, nor too small. The bartenders are really friendly and Irish! I had a great time and would definitely recommend! We're for sure coming back for seconds.
author: Ana F.

description:
We used to call D.N. our "Regal Beagle" since it was just a block away from our old place.  Our local standby - even all of our friends had at one point and time been there with us.  When we first moved to the area, we were there so often that we became labeled "the girls" (like being "Norm" on "Cheers"!).

You almost feel like you're in a foreign country with all the fresh-off-the-boat Irish movers and construction workers (whose speech always gets a little harder to understand after a few pints.) I don't know, sometimes I'd wonder, "They're still speaking in English, right?"

Brendan is the best - like a big 'ol teddy bear offering you peppermint schnapps shots (which you have to take along with him).  Orin is usually always there too (sorry, I know I spelled his name wrong - it's some weird Gaelic spelling).  He does an awesome version of Elton John's "Your Song" - get him to sing it on karaoke night.  Who knew the boy could sing?

Ahh... I miss this place...Where everybody knows your name, and they're always glad you came.
author: Van Ness D.

description:
This is a very cool neighborhood Irish Pub.  I came here for the first time because it is just around the corner from my new place.  Let's just say I have been a repeat customer.  
The first thing you will notice upon enter  Durty Nelly's is that it is small, with some booth seating and a very cute fireplace.  It is just the place to warm up with a drink here in the Sunset.  This is especially true since they have awesome Guinness.  I am very particular about my Guinness.  A few years back I took a month hitchhiking around Ireland and developed what I would call quite an appreciation for the stuff, but only if it is good.  I would have to say that Durty Nelly's has the best Guinness I have ever had in the USA.  

Overall, this is a great place to have an excellent Guinness and hang out in a really comfortable, chill environment.
author: Kate B.

description:
If this place lacks anything, then its "Durty"ness:  the place is clean!  Spotless!  And very well lit, which is weird for a bar, I must admit, but really--its not Durty 'tall.

I've only been in here once though, so maybe it was a fluke.  The beer selection isn't that great, though, and thats something that doesn't change often.

Otherwise my only experience with Durty Nellies is the INSANE amount of noise that comes from this place every Thrusday - Saturday nights that I get to enjoy since I live really close by.  A couple weeks ago, I got to hear an Irish rendition of Doris Day's "Que Sera, Sera (Whatever Will Be, Will Be)" sung with think Irish accents and replete with profane lyrics.  It was beautiful.  Even if it woke me up at 2 in the morning.
author: Thomas M.

description:
An Irish pub in the outer sunset?  What's going on here?

Actually, apparently the Sunset does have a substantial Irish expatriate population (see the Shannon Arms).  Anyway, one of the things that sets Durty Nelly's apart, aside from its location, is its great pub menu, particularly the Irish Breakfast.  Irish bacon, sausage, eggs & beans, perfectly buttered toast, and of course the delectable blood sausages (if only there were bigger!).  If you're not hungry, still a great laid-back place for a pint.
author: Wes M.

description:
This is The Irish Pub of San Francisco - not kell's or some trendy bar.  This is Ireland.  I can't understand anything anyone is saying until I have 2 Guinness'.  The music is awesome!  There is a musician that has been paying at Nelly's for years who is unbelievable.  Last time I was in there he had everyone singing before 10pm.  This is one of my favorites...it is a dive - but a dive with love...Everyone I've taken there has had a blast.  There has not been a time I've been where I haven't.  Be ready to sing, smile and get dizzy...

One of my Favs Fo Sho!!!  Do it!
author: Siamak S.

description: Excellent place with great service and good people!!! Best bar I have been to in awhile :)
author: Tiffany B.

description:
Guinness with the 2/3s pour, then fill.  Just the right amount of foam.  A slight ($0.50) discount compared to many other bars, too.

I've yet to try the food, but I'll have to try Durty Nelly's again sometime.
author: Jin D.

description: Now this is my kind of place.  Drinks are freezing cold, food is blazing hot, good and tasty.  True Irish ex-pats here so you know it is not some cheesy Irish knock off.  Located in a small neighborhood way off the tourist path, this is where you want to relax and have a drink.  Even as a new face, you will be welcomed like you have been there for years.  On a cool, foggy night, the fireplace makes you feel at home.
author: David C.

description:
Got good and drunk here last week.  Food was awesome.  GREAT Fish & Chips.  We went for lunch and stayed for dinner.  Yeah, you're jealous.  I'll vouch for the shepherd's pie, and the burger, too.  

Nothing not to like.  It's hilariously placed in the middle of a chinese market area.  There's REAL, from-Ireland, Irish people there, and I mean all the bartenders I've met and all ten people at the bar the last time I was there.  

Except for a really freakin funny older lady who told me my '73 SuperBeetle is probably the one her friend used to own because it sounds the same and was the same color, then delighted my tipsy roommate and I with stories of running from the Nevada highway patrol during her racing days.  I wanted to keep her.
author: Jimmy C.

description: The most authentic Irish Bar in San Francisco...by far!!!!! You will have the best nights craic here and hear lots of Irish accents and enjoy tasty wholesome food. The pub quiz on a Wednesday nite is great banter and come on the weekends and hear live Irish music.!!! This is def a home away from home :)
author: Natasha M.

description:
This place looked great on paper - authentic, fun, and mellow. In reality I have mixed feelings about this place. 

The plus:
    probably one of the only bars in this Sunset area
    drunk Irish people
    drinks are fairly priced

The negatives:
    overly drunk Irish men who accost everyone - including guys and girls
    music - eh
    crowd - eh

This place is a good place to come get drinks with a group of your friends if you  just want to drink and talk. This isn't a great place for insane party atmosphere. The place is nice just not my vibe.
author: Sasha B.

description:
THE PUB. 

Crowd is the CRAIC. Brendan the barkeep is freaking awesome...but don't cross him and don't break his glasses.
 Darcy will unhook your bra, turn a barstool upside down and play bagpipes for you, or rip a napkin in half and give you his version of Phantom of the Opera. 
Marc will dig you a hole (the BEST HOLE you've ever seen), and karaoke Lady Gaga with you. 
Family away from home, for sure.
author: katie b.

description:
I luv this place... Straight up Irish Pub just how you want it.. The place is quite small but cozy & got a good ambiance... 

The best Irish Pub in that whole strip I must say... Quite interesting with their variety of drinks there... The Cherry Bomb is a must try... Got it all buzzed a few times but my friends & I still come back for more ;-)

Brandon is the best bartender there.. He's a big teddy bear & so happy always :-)

Beside the drinks, the burger is so yummy & only $9 with fries & pickles, now that's a steal!

They also have happy hours... Well, we always happy when we go there so nuff said ;-)
author: Manda Bear B.

description:
For me the best thing about Durty Nelly's is that it is a 5 minute walk from my house.  Now if you are not lucky enough to live so close to such a cool bar, then there are plenty of other reasons to go to Durty Nelly's.  It has a good pub atmosphere, with friendly bartenders and fun patrons!  

Let me tell you this, there is always something interesting going on at Durty Nelly's.  Every time I go there, I leave with an awesome story.  The last time I was there, this regular was telling me how the woman at the bar is a prostitute while a group of drunk guys pretended to bobsled on one of the barstools.  Good times had by all.  They also have some pretty good live music on weekends.  

I haven't really had any of their food...but once when I went in there for an early drink, I saw some people finishing their meals.  They looked pretty happy.
author: kim l.

description: Coming from a seasoned service industry worker, I tell you that this is a must hit spot whether you live in  SF or are just visiting thus awesomely epic city. I had  the opportunity to eat here recently , and I tell you, one thing I do know is that the cooks they have in the back of house are passionate about the food they cook, and view the establishment  not as just a job they have to pay the bills, but rather a way of life. That culinary art, is quickly becoming lost with thus day and age, and it is good to know they are striving to keep the art alive. I assure you that the creative mind in which  drives chef Daniel, is always something you want to put in your mouth, like just gobble on.... I'm saying, you could eat here everyday, and still have a pallet that gets blown away on the daily. Want some knowledge dropped on those taste buds of yours? Come to this fuggin place! I give this place 5 stars W/O a doubt. And,  there is also a guy with a rad Mohawk in the kitchen... reminds me of Portland Oregon. Anyways,  If you are visiting California, and enjoy good food, then skip this spot and go to In N Out burger... If you want food y'all will want to confess your undying love for from the top of a mountain, go to Durty Nelly's. Then to Alaska, because that was the only location in which I could find a peak high enough to match the epicness in which Durty Nelly's embraces on a consistent basis. Since
author: Chris R.

description:
Way way out in the Sunset, hidden in a foggy sea of Asian restaurants lies an Irish oasis called Durty Nellys.

On the weekends an Irish band plays to a small but lively crowd of drunk Irish expats. Expect some serious tabletop dancing when Sweet Caroline and American Girl are played.
author: Dave S.

description:
I remember it's a Wednesday night. Tons people very knowledge answer all kinds of questions about American culture. (I barely remember names and other stuff... Shame on me! Can't help my pp) I believe their final price after rolling the snowballing, will be over $200! Although I don't have a chance to win... But anyway, it's a small nice place hang out with your real friends. Very comfortable. Friendly folks. Bartender was really nice as well. 
PS. if the lighting wasn't that bright on the Wed. I think i will give 5 stars. lol
author: Flora F.

description:
I live about 2 blocks away from this pub - a genuine Irish pub with a geniune Irish bar-tender who, if you happen to be a couple girls who've already had a pint will pour some shots for everyone and do one with you. 

Oh yes. It's that kind of place. Since it's in the Outer Sunset it seems to balance between being really busy or really quiet. Busy because it's one of the only places around or quiet because - well. It's the Outer Sunset. Either way, it's a great place to be 2 blocks from. Make's the journey home so much shorter.
author: Megan S.

description: Lively bar, but not too large inside with maybe 4 booths and a few small tables. Good place to hang out at night, especially around this area on Irving. The night we came here, the entire floor was covered in sand, couldn't feel the floor. Festive.
author: Ray C.

description:
I really enjoy Durty's.  if you come here, you will find:
good music
good people
good service
good beer

but the real reason i go here is for the chicken curry fries.  wow.
author: Charley B.

description:
Love this place. After moving to the Sunset we were looking for a bar in stumbling distance from home and we found it. The selection of booze is great, the food is very good and the staff is awesome.
The best thing is the majority of the patrons are Irish and they will take you in and not make you feel like an outsider.
We love to drink with the Irish.
author: Cassandra C.

description:
I'm a regular at the Sunset bars and this one is, in my opinion, the best.  It has the best atmosphere (a cozy living room vibe with a fireplace), excellent musicians (there's not much room to dance but people make it work), and a good crowd; by the time the bar closes, you will know 80% of the people in the bar and will keep most of them as life-long friends.  

The price is about the same as other Sunset bars, maybe $0.25 more a beer, but much cheaper than downtown SF.  I haven't tried the food yet but it looks absolutely delicious.  Parking is kind of rough around dinner-hour (there are many Asian restaurants in the neighborhood), but you'll always find a spot.
author: Elisabeth G.

description:
Hate to do this to ya Nelly's but ya struck me wrong one too many times.  Lived in the neighborhood and just couldn't make this place click despite several visits.  I've found it much easier to dig in at other bars in the area, but for some reason Durty Nelly's always made me feel uncomfortable - like I didn't belong there.  Several times I sat at the bar for ages waiting for the bartender to step away from his crony's to even say hello. The taller guy was the stinker - sometimes, would even help the guy right next to me then walk away.  Met some cool folks at Durty Nelly's and the place always seems very fun, but like I said, just didn't happen for me.

They have live music which is often fantastic, they have their own kitchen but I've never tried the food and noticed that a lot of the regulars buy food down the street and bring it into the place.  Overall, the atmosphere is incredible, perfect lighting, great decor, but maybe I wasn't Irish enough to be there.  Maybe you need Carhards on to make this place work - not that I ever wore a tie or even slacks.  Dunno what it was, just never settled in - too bad too cuz it was a block from my house - and it wasn't for lack of tryin.
author: Jack S.

description: Irish style pub with great grub. I prefer dark beers and the only dark beer they have on draught is Guinness, their selection of draught beer in general is a bit lacking with only a hand full to choose from. Despite the lack of draught beer, I continue to patron the place for the food and close proximity to my house. My favorites on the menue are: The Nelly Burger, Fish and Chips, Shepard's Pie, and the daily soups.
author: Matt K.

description:
My boyfriend and I lived in the sunset for as long as I can remember and this is the first time we've ever been to Durty Nelly's. For our first experience it was awesome! The bar tender gave us free shots just for wearing green! The bangers and mash was awesomely delicious! I loved how they put mushrooms and onions into the dish, and the gravy sauce for the mash potatoes were absolutely yum! The sausage was cooked just right too! I am soo making him take me again, next Friday! hehe. 
This place has great food! great people! and awesome drinks! 
Kudos to the bartender who gave us free shots!
author: Annie Y.

description: great food and drinks, nice place to get out of the cold weather, the food is awesome cooked in a little stove in the back like homemade.  i reccomend the mushrooms appitiezer.
author: Louis B.

description: Absolutely love this irish pub!!!!!! Brendan is an awesome lad and if you become a regular, will cut u you a break on beers big time! The other bartender I've only seen once when there was live music...he is a younger lad, very nice and upbeat. Very fun place! Drinks are a bit pricey but the crowds are generally cool and my hubby and I always have a great time. Great variety of ages.
author: Maddy B.

description: Awesome atmosphere, very cozy, great music and food. Would def be a local here if I lived in the area.
author: Natalia M.

description:
durty nelly's is similar to the pubs in the smaller towns and country parts of ireland. it's quite cozy, the patrons are friendly, the bar staff are personable, and it is without the glitz and glam of modern day bars. there are comfy booths and tables, walls adorned with photos and artwork from the emerald isle, and ample space for standing room and dancing. 

there were two regulars; a very cute japanese couple who are in their golden years. everyone appeared to know them, greet, and toast the couple. they warmed my heart as the husband took the hand of his lady and led her to dance to the live band's tunes. they were the only couple dancing that evening. as they exited the booth before their departure, he twirled her around for the last dance of the evening. they were applauded as they left. a prime example of the pubs in ireland where the young and people in their golden years can cohabit ate, and enjoy and imbibe together.
author: Sheri N.

description:
I don't get it.  the whole left side of this pub smells like pee.  i might understand it if it were like 2 am on a friday but we're talkin about dinner time on a weekday night here.  

i got here with my buddies and we sat down at the first booth.. 3 minutes later we realized that the familiar odor we were smelling was most likely urea.  

we then left and ate at gordon biersch.. which was also disappointing.  

still since i was only there 5 minutes i'm giving them the benefit of the doubt and giving them 3 stars.  

please disinfect your establishment for the next time i come.  thank you.
author: William S.

description:
Here is how hard I searched to find something wrong with this place.... I didn't get why they had the singer sewing machine on the wall.  That's it.  That is my majour complaint.  I couldn't find anything to bitch about.

I don't normally bitch.. really, I don't.  But I just thought, a place called Durty Nelly's is setting itself up for misery... but NO!!!!  I walk in and we had a local football game, and an across the pond FUTBALL game.... Newcastle versus Leeds.  I think.... but SOOOO GOOD.  College and premier league at the same time?  So good.

Small.  Simple.  I got whiskey and a guinness.  They seemed to like that.

Great gal barkeeping.... quick, attentive... rad.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
I love this place.  I have some friends who live around the corner, so when i go, i suppose that i get the 'local' treatment.  that said...

Curry chips..  HELLS YEAH.  fish and chips...  HELLS YEAH..  regular chips..  HELLS YEAH.  Drunken Irishmen (literally ) playing the bag pipes (upside down bar stool...), at 5PM...  HELLS YEAH.

Seriously, they have live music at nights, damn good food for an Irish pub, good drink prices..  and the owner/bartender is known to just come around and pour shots of peppermint schnapps for no reason other than you look like you have a nice face.  

What's not to love?
author: Robert R.

description:
I love this place! Stop in for a Guinness and a lamb burger and share some fries on a sunny afternoon, when the door and windows are open. It's impossible to feel you're in San Francisco when you're surrounded by all the wood and Irish locals. Or stop in early on trivia night and have a steak first. Outstanding and worth every penny! Soups are delicious, salads are great and extremely fresh, breakfast is so yummy and huge you can almost feed two. I've ordered more than half the menu over the course of time and have never had anything that wasn't fresh and delicious. Not just good - delicious.
I feel very comfortable and relaxed in this pub. I've never felt like a stranger. The bartender makes it look effortless and treats everyone like we've always been patrons.
But, please, don't go there. I don't want to get there sometime and not be able to get in because it's too popular to hold everyone who really appreciates it for what it is - a great neighborhood pub that welcomes one and all. It's not a fashion show, not the place to be seen, not a place to wheel and deal. Just a nice little pub that welcomes me whenever I show up.
author: Marilyn V.

description: This place knows how to pour a Guinness! Plus trivia night on Wednesday, a friendly crowd, and great bar food!  By the end of the night I thought even I should be speaking with an Irish accent. That is, until I was told I sounded more like Borat.
author: Beth J.

description:
Great place to go on a rainy winter's night.  The fireplace (and booze) warmed us right up.  Totally cozy!  The pub food is good.  Fries are great!  The people working there were VERY nice.  

Look for the Irish flag in the middle of all of the Chinese places....
author: Summer M.

description: I was here to watch one of the last GIants games of the regular season. It wasn't crowded at all until much later, so the boys and I were able to sit at the bar with little wait. The chicken curry fries are pretty damn good, though maybe could use a little bit of vegetables in it to give more flavor. They only take cash, but that's all made up for since they don't have tax.
author: Matthew D.

description:
Ah, where to go for dinner on a work night in the Sunset?  Hmmm... we've done Thai a bit too much recently... Chinese?  Nah.  Durty Nelly's?  What the hell, right?

Their menu is tiny, but it's what you'd expect from a pub.  We had the fish and chips and it was pretty standard.  I don't know what it is about fish and chips; I'm never totally satisfied, but I order it time and time again anyway.  Not much of a beer selection on tap, but they've got a few good choices as well as the ubiquitous Guinness and Smithwick's.

Mmm... Smithwick's.

I'll definitely come back here for more than a meal and a beer next time.

...but what's up with Irish pubs and all the old instruments and luggage up on the shelves as decoration?
author: Zach P.

description: HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!  I am 27 years old, I went in with my 2 co-workers, and the manager of the bar wanted to refuse me service claiming that I had a fake ID.  Not only that, he threw my ID on the table laughing saying it was fake, and then to some of his regulars starting complaining that I had a fake ID.  I had to take out my work ID to "prove" to him that I was of age.  My two other coworkers who are younger than me were not denied service, just me. Not only that, we ordered fish and chips, and there was a hair in the fish....... What a shame.
author: Margaret Z.

description: Love Dirty Nelly's! It is cozy, it is clean, and it is full of good people. They have good food, they have music on popular evenings, and they can really throw a party. I have been going there for years and the only change is that it is more popular now than ever. As far as bars go in that area, this one is a winner!
author: Katie C.

description:
Random dancing abounds in front of, behind and on top of the bar while good music is dj'd, the bartenders keep the drinks flowing and Irish Curry hot. 

Unlike most, I was dragged into Nelly's by my new roommates. Though the deal wasn't sealed until I'd downed 3 Magner's, 2 Peppermint Schnapps, and a Cherry Bomb - in the span of 2 hours. I was then told any other pub was dead to me. 

So, I could hang with the big boys and was allowed to rent the small room in the back of the house and "share a few gud laughs with the lads" all the while getting completely scottered before being gentlemanly walked home to be dumped in my yet to be paid for room so I could snooze off the booze before stumbling to work the next day. 

Oh how the coworkers loved the smell of stale liquor exuding from my pores.
author: Carrie S.

description:
I love it here. I think of it as my neighborhood bar, even though I live in SOMA. I go at least once a week, especially on Trivia Night. My team has won once and we actually have a shot at winning every week. Just the right amount of teams with questions that are challenging, but not impossible.

Both the beers and questions are served by genuine Irishmen: accents and all. How can you argue with that? I'd give this pub 5 stars on the beer and crowd alone, but to top it all off, the food is fantastic! The fries are an obvious choice, perfectly seasoned and with homemade garlic mayo dip. Mmmm. I also recently had the chicken strips (which also come with the dip!). The batter was super light and crispy and the lime wedges to squeeze over top of them were a pleasant and delicious surprise.

Spell durty any way you want- I will be sure to come back again and again.
author: Jennie H.

description:
Popped in here randomly one Saturday afternoon. Twas mellow and comfortable.

We just stopped by for a drink but the food menu actually looked pretty good. I'm not a fan of bar grub but I bet I would enjoy a few things off their menu with a good buzz.

Good place, nice staff, good vibe. 
Good day!
author: alexa c.

description:
It is said that San Francisco has the most Irish Pubs per capita in the United States. I'm not sure if that's true, but I could believe it. The problem is, almost every Irish pub in SF is a caricature of an Irish pub. Sure, they have the Guinness, and sometime the Harp and Smithwicks, and sometimes the right whiskeys. But most pubs in this town are so kitschy and outwardly glowing about their "Irishness" that I just can't take it anymore.

That's where Durty Nelly's comes in. THIS is the trust, most justifiable and most honest Irish pub I've seen, not only in SF, but anywhere in this country. THIS is what an Irish pub is. This is how an Irish pub should act and function.

Now, on this street, which is 95% asian businesses, you wouldn't expect this. But I'm fairly certain Durty Nelly's predates those establishments and remains a fixture of old San Francisco. The neighborhood is not conducive to pub crawling, drinking, or even fine dining. I would never come out here if it wasn't for this place. But, it's worth the trip and it's worth the struggle for parking.

So what's the big deal? Durty Nelly's has every element that is required of a true Irish pub.
- Owned and operated by actual Irish people
- Frequented by actual Irish regulars
- Proud of Ireland but not in a brash or "St Patty's Day" kind of way
- They have Guinness, Harp, Smithwick's, and a Cider on tap
- They pour your Guinness properly, giving it the 120 seconds it deserves
- They serve everything else "Irish style" such as serving a glass with ice along with your cider (this is one tradition I did now know prior to visiting)
- Customers mingle with each other and buy each other drinks...regularly
- They have musicians sitting in the corner, by the fireplace, playing music (some Irish, some U2-type pop)
- They serve everyone with an equal amount of general interest and disinterest
- They serve Irish pub food, which I've heard (but haven't confirmed) is pretty good.

Again, THIS is what you want from a quality Irish pub. Durty Nelly's delivers.
author: Tolga E.

description: Really cute place! Fireplace and everything. When we got there it was really chill but then they turned up the music super loud. It was a bit distracting but overall It's a super cute hang out for people who live in the sunset.
author: Victoria F.

description:
We came here because my friend said she always sees people yelling at each other out front and she wanted to go see if we'd be able to witness a bar fight.  Well, it was a Saturday night -- albeit a bit early -- and it was fairly mellow.  But it was great!  A great place to sit back with your friends and laugh over a beer.

We sat at the very back grungy table near the kitchen, bathrooms and jukebox.  At one point, we could hear jock jams-style music (hahahaha) coming from the kitchen and weird 90's music coming from the jukebox, neither of which was expected.  But it was definitely appreciated.
author: Tamara M.

description:
This is "my bar". Authentic, great company, great staff, BEST Guinness...a real Irish pub. It's in my neighborhood, a total gem of a pub...but I would be more than willing to travel across the city to go here. Trust me, it's a cozy bar, nothing bad about it.

I could go on and on about it,tell long stories about experiences I have in this place, good memories and so on---- but i will keep it simple. Its just the best Irish pub in the city. Take my word for it.
author: dur A.

description:
As an expat, I am not ashamed to say that I love a good old fashioned pub quiz. Maybe I am settling into my years but there is nothing more pleasant than going to your local bar and sitting down with a bunch of people to try to guess at trivia you have no idea about. And o, the feeeling of euphoria that is experienced when you 'GET ONE RIGHT'.

Thats right folks, ever Wednesday night, Durty Nellie's hosts a pub quiz. And there is no better setting. Durty Nellies has a really comfortable feel - even with my haphazard attendance, I still feel like a local. And for a busy bar, we normally always get a seat. The bartender (Otie?) is really friendly (I too have become victim to the Cherry Bomb) and always welcomes you in with a smile. The regulars are a fabulous mix of characters (Darcy... who has clearly struck a chord with a few). And their food is pretty good - chicken curry & chops, BLT, fish and chips... proper pub fare and done well too. Long may Durty Nellie's reign as one of the best pubs in the city.
author: Catriona C.

description:
This place was seriously jumpin' after Friday night's Outside Lands fest.

Somehow, friends got a booth, so we were isolated from the crush of people in here.

The DJ (who was actually just a dude with a laptop) was really cute and played a lot of fun songs to sing (plus requests) so the entire bar, probably mostly music fans, were really singing along. I finally got the "drinking and singing in an Irish bar" thing. :)
author: Emily M.

description: How many bars can you walk into as a first time patron and be hooked up with free shots of Patron? Probably not that many, but this place is one of them!
author: Jeffrey J.

description: One of my favorite bars in the city.  Don't come here if you are prissy and afraid of getting your pretty shoes stepped on or a beer spilled down your outfit from J. Crew.  Yancy's is up the street.  This is the kind of place where tables get knocked down on the regular (usually because someone is dancing on it), and you have to dance your way to the bathroom to get through the crowd.  The people are usually decent about stepping aside to let you get to the bar (nowhere is safe from the occasional d-bag).  The bar staff are fun and friendly, and the music is great, whether live or playing off the Mac.  They don't have a huge variety of beers on tap, but they do have a good whiskey selection.
author: sara b.

description: Durty Nelly's is a fun place with live music, it's where we head after dinner at Coco's across the street, but somehow despite the fact that we leave CoCo's stuffed, we always get the Curry Fries at Nelly's, too.  Just watch out if you drink cider, they put ice in it for some reason.
author: Crystal B.

description:
Not much to say about this irish pub (i thought we only had these in New York?), except their drinks pack a mean punch! I tried some of Amanda B.'s Cherry Bomb and it was indeed serious!

I must say, extra star for the fact that they let us take our drinks out of this place to Coco's Crawfish across the street!

Drink up!
author: William C.

description:
Durty Nelly's is awesome.  I've always walked by it on Irving st. but never walked in.  Well all that changed on Saturday.  It is actually a very nice and cozy place.  With a fireplace, and a couple tables and booths.  Wow, who would have thunk it?

I met the bartender Brendon and also another bartender named Odie.  They are hilarious and super friendly.  Me being perhaps the only asian guy in an Irish bar.  But they made me feel welcome and I had a blast.  

The atmosphere is just an all around warm and almost homey feeling that made me not want to leave.  Well, after quite a few drinks, and the liquor still flowing, I actually had to get out of there.  But all in all, a great place, and I'm glad to have discovered it!
author: Terence P.

description: Half community center, half bar, half amazing restaurant, half bad with fractions.  This place is really an fantastic place to come for lunch, and quick drink, or a fun night.  The regular crowd are are really friendly people and the service is with a genuine smile.
author: Ellis b.

description:
For three years I have been searching for the best Irish bar in San Francisco and finally found it. Big shout-out to Robb for bringing me to Durty Nelly's last Saturday. We spent hours sampling variations of Irish Coffees and hot toddies. Tonight I am going back to try their humble dinner menu. I hear there Irish Breakfast is crazy.
I have only two small critiques;  1-The jukebox. Looks like it the music selection caters to the college crowd which make me nervous. But at-least there is a healthy collection of Rolling Stones. 2-Not the largest selection of Whiskey. Adding some Bulliet and Eagle would make it complete. Until then, I am happy with Jameson's.
author: Alejandro M.

description:
I went to this place to meet some friends the other night.  I was excited because I never go to the outer sunset and it's nice to know that there's some cool hang outs.  Cozy irish bar with comfy-looking booths. I guess they sell food there but I got there at 11pm anyway.  People were pretty cool and friendly too. This was a friday night. I don't know how it is on other nights.  There was a really, really, really drunk girl that passed out at the bar.  She was taken out by her boyfriend.  But repeatedly kept stumbling back in.  I thought that was both annoying and amusing. 
All in all fun place, good music!
author: Liz F.

description: I've been hanging here on and off with a friend who frequents here. its a little far from home to get my drink on, but... the beers are excellent, food is good, and the bartenders are great. He pulled out some cherry bombs and that basically kept me in my seat for another 45 minutes. always nice to get treated... and its always nice to be in an Irish bar where the majority of peeps are actually Irish. It would be like finding a Chinese restaurant where the majority of the peeps are Chinese.  Its that good.
author: Adam X.

description:
I could not be any more pleased to have this as my neighborhood bar. The whiskey selection is plentiful, they have Smithwick's and Magner's on draft and they have great bartenders. I've gotten embarassingly drunk here a few times, but then again that's what you come here for so no one judges you for it. You know a bar is good when the Irish population of the Sunset comes out in droves for it. 

Beware of impromptu wrestling matches and flailing limbs during Irish drinking songs.

If you want to do more than just get hammered they have a nice selection of traditional bar and Irish food. The fish and chips is damn good.
author: Don H.

description:
This bar is pretty slick. It has to be one of the busiest bars in the sunset at night. The drinks are decently priced and Ive never had any problems with the bartenders. 

The thing that really wowed me about this place was the good food that they serve during the day. Its not your ordinary bar food. It is really well done.  Ive eaten here about 5 times, and have enjoyed myself on every occasion.
author: josh b.

description: Admittedly, I don't completely recall the night I went to Durty Nelly's.  But I remember having fun.  Vague flashes of dancing on tables and chairs, talking to random people, strong drinks, and people stepping on me.  More or less all of the necessary components for an entertaining night of drunken debauchery.  Except the fact that it took us about a half hour to obtain the drinks to attain the debauched level, which really irritated me while still dead sober.  I got over it though.  And woke up with a scraped knee. I'm choosing to interpret that as a sign of fun-time having.
author: Jenny R.

description: So yeah, it's cool there are actual Irish people there, and it's a decent place to watch sports, but why is the Guinness served ICE cold? They should know better....
author: Cate M.

description: Durty Nelly's has been my favorite place to go out to since the first time I stepped into inside in December of 2000. Even when I didn't live in the neighborhood I would venture out to the Sunset for the fabulous trivia nights with Peter on Wednesday nights or for a fun night out any day of the week or weekend! Their new chef is a great addition to the Nelly's family and of course I have to mention the fabulous bartenders who I am happy to also call my friends. Nelly's is truly my home away from home!
author: Elisabeth C.

description:
This is the absolute best Irish bar in SF 
Its a bit out of the way (about a 20 cab ride from downtown) but so worth it ..
plus you get to see the ocean and a much cleaner part of the city
Its filled with irish people, great juke box, big fire place for cold days
fantastic and cheap food and great drinks
definately come here when in SF
author: maryanncolby

description:
Durty Nelly's has so far been my go-to chippie (someone who does fried food, especially "chips" and fish) in San Francisco. The key things for me have been having Smithwicks and Magners (Apple Cider) on tap while keeping an orderly house, the bartenders are very good about stopping trouble from having a chance to start. The kitchen is basic but satisfying, but be aware that the portions of some items are not going to be "steakhouse sized." Personally, the Irish Breakfast as well as the fish & chips are my favorites.

The jukebox is something that KFOG, 107.7 The Bone or Alice@97.3 radio would be fine playing, plus some folk and other mixes, in addition to the staff's ipod. The crowd gets a bit mixed later on the night, but there is a mix of clientele that usually ranges from the late 20s to the 40s.

This is place that I go to in order to meet up with friends, to have a quiet pint, or a leisurely early-evening dinner. There are a few ATMs in the surrounding neighborhood, so grabbing cash on the way is not much of a hassle.
author: William F.

description:
people say koreans are the irish of the east. i think the irish are the koreans of the west. we drink, we fight, and we drink some more. we both have uptight nieghbors which we cant stand, *cough* japanese, british... *cough* and we both are the largest producers and/or consumers of scotch whiskey in the world.
