ive been here a few times, most of the time with amanda in tow with cherry bombs in hand, so you know its gonna be a fun time. 

i have no qualms about supporting the last signs of whiteness in chinatown III. these guys seem like good folks. i loved their curry fries, and the drinks were stiff. 

fun times.
author: Euge L.

description: You walk into Durty Nelly's and you feel like you were transported to a lodge somewhere in the mountains.  They have plaid curtains, a wood interior and a roaring fireplace.  There are typically several Irishman around the bar sipping Guinness after a days work and on Wed. they have trivia night - which I still have yet to make it too but, will soon!  Its a very nice Sunset Tavern.
author: Kra C.

description:
This is my neighborhood bar where I hang at. I will venture across town for fun and games and then stop here for a cocktail or two on my way home. The bar changed ownership about a year ago. It is owned by a handsome young Irish lad now. The cook serves food til 9 pm. He can make some really tastey Irish dishes (Fish and Chips) and he takes requests for specials. The food is what makes this place rock!

so a new cook has taken over- she rocks! Brandon rocks! Live Music on Saturday rocks- Odie or Sabbath- both are great!
author: Johnna R.

description:
i love durty nellys so much that i hardly let myself go anymore because every time i go, SOMETHING happens.

don't go on quiz night or any busy night where a buncha white kids are gonna jack your vibes. go during a sunny afternoon and be surrounded by oirishmen and drink endless delicious draft ciders (w/ice, of course). then the bartenders will keep you giving you strange cocktails called cherry bombs to shoot. then suddenly you are very drunk. and your tab is only 5 dollars. but you always get home eventually.

25th ave is the way to go for real. legit.

also you can get CURRY CHIPS here which is the most important thing. i went to an irish pub here that served me chicken and chips with a side of ranch. horror.
author: jessica s.

description: 5 Stars all the way after digging into a batch of Chicken Curry with chips (french fries). Yum! Plus, the cider wasn't that bad either. I just fell in love with the SF yelpers joining in on the fun here. Not a big place to hold more than 20+ yelpers in a small pub...it's okay! I enjoyed brushing up against someone...I mean, nevermind. The music...listening to a guy sing ol' school music to mainstream music you hear off the radio...a big plus because everyone was rockin' it out by singing along with him. The owner was nice enough to give Manda Bear cherry bombs to a couple of yelpers....on the house! woohoo! Love it.
author: Fraulein C.

description:
oh shit. this place serves food?! i did NOT know that.   i always thought this place was a bar and only opened at night. 

i came here for lunch. no alcohol for me. food only. i cant go back to work smelling like beer. *sad face*  i ordered their BLT. omg, it was sooooooo delicious! probably the best BLT i've had in a while. err, on irving street.  their french fries were really good too. not too greasy. and i think they might have been fresh. it didnt taste like they were from the freezer. anyway, i really liked my meal!

so i got my bill and my total was $7 (which is the price of the BLT). what?! no tax?! o-well. i'm not complaining. i'll be back to try their other food.
author: B B.

description:
It's always a good time at Nelly's. Friendly bartenders, happy Irish drinkers, and you won't want to miss out on a conversation with Darcy, a Nelly's regular. He's been there pretty much every time I have, and depending on how drunk he is, his stories and jokes are definitely memorable. The food at Nelly's is also really good, especially the fish and chips! I will definitely go back for those again. My only complaint is that on friday and saturday nights they typically have a guy play acoustic guitar for entertainment, and I promise you he will butcher the hell out of all your favorite 90's alternative songs. But at least everyone there is enjoying it and having fun, and it makes for something you can laugh about the next day. 

Go on a weeknight, drink a guinness (or smithwicks), eat the fish and chips, and talk to darcy. I'm sure you'll have a great time.
author: Brian F.

description: I love curry fries.  They are a heavenly combination of the two best things in the whole world (fries, and curry).  Whoever thought to combine them was a genius.  When I moved to SF, I went on a mission to find good curry fries (because driving to San Jose to get them at Trial's seemed silly).  And I was excited when Yelp pointed me to Durty Nelly's.  But Durty Nelly's did not live up to my curry fry expectations.  I was sad.  I will keep driving to San Jose.
author: Meghan S.

description: Super friendly bartenders, great neighborhood feel, warm fireplace, open booths, fun quiz night. Only problem is that the draft beers are $5.50 and the tartar sauce is super runny.
author: c t.

description: This place ROCKS!!!!!  I walked in and felt a bit out of place as the bartender knew everyone in the joint except me and my girlie.  However, everyone turned out to be super friendly and welcoming.  The bartender was serving drinks to people before they even ordered ("they're all regulars - I know what they like to drink" the bartender said with a lovely irish lilt).  We ordered some chips (french fries) which were delicious with our guinesses.  Next time we want to try the curried chicken and chips.  I wish I lived closer to this place so I could just stumble in when I was thirsty.
author: Curtis H.

description: Not typically my kind of bar scene, but it is a rather cool Irish pub. This bar is consistently busy, always with people partying inside and out. I went there on St. Patrick's Day and it was PACKED. But what impressed me the most was the steak dinner I had there sometime after. Everything was done perfectly and went great with my glass of guinness. No complaints, it's a classy bar in the sunset that knows how to party and make great food.
author: Katie S.

description: While the black and tan wasn't properly poured, best bangers and mash I've had in San Francisco, maybe ever, and really nice people.
author: Grant M.

description: Great neighborhood bar.  We recently moved here from Wisconsin and coming here we were warmly welcomed.  Lots of great conversation.  I cannot wait to go back.
author: Matti S.

description: Brendan the bartender is second only to Brian from Martin Macks (now Danny Coyle's) in best-bartender-ever status.
author: Megan W.

description: So I reviewed this bar YEARS ago and complained that it's not a friendly place for people of colour, and, as it turns out, queer people are not welcome either. Avoid.
author: Amiee C.

description: I don't live in the bay, but wish that I did so that I could go to this place all the time!  My friend lives in the area and frequents the Irish bars quite often.  Naturally, when I was in town for the weekend we hit up Durty Nelly's.  One of the bartenders, I believe his name is Odie, was playing live music in the corner by the fireplace all night long.  He sounded awesome too!  People were dancing and have a great time, especially an Irishman named Darcy.  He was a dancing machine! Good times, good times...
author: Caitlin F.

description: I guess I could consider Durty Nelly's my local, though I don't really go there regularly enough.  It is as authentically publike as you can get in San Francisco.  They have decent pub grub (curry and chips, shepherds pie are both pretty yummy) and, of course, Guinness on tap.  Not a huge selection of beer, but when you have Guinness, what more do your really need, now really?  They don't even seem to mind that my husband is English, so that's a plus for an Irish pub, too. ;) Friendly bartenders and clientele.
author: Cami B.

description: What more can you want from a neighborhood bar?  Friendly bartenders, ever flowing Jamesons, a cozy fireplace and decent food.  The fact that its walking distance isn't bad either, but its worth the trek even for those that live more than seven blocks away - especially on Wednesdays for trivia!
author: Jenny E.

description: This officially became my favorite bar after a group of random people with Irish accents started talking to my friends and I. We shared stories, had drinks, and it was one of the best nights. Since then I returned several time and the trend I see, is the people that come to this bar are so friendly and fun, this includes the bar staff. The service was amazing and the drinks were cheap and strong. The best nights to go are Wednesdays for Quiz night or Saturdays to listen to some live music. I just wish I lived closer, because I would be here all the time.
author: Nicole W.

description: This place is great and I highly recommend it, but it's definitely a $$ kind of place.  I hadn't been here in a while and was looking for good, warm, cheap dinner.  What I got was a delicious dinner that was more than I had planned on spending now that I'm jobless.
author: Daniel H.

description: I've been into this bar a few times with the bf and love it.  Friendly neighborhood bar, the staff is attentive.  They remembered us after the first time we had been in.  The drinks are strong, prices reasonable, music is good, and it's a fun crowd.  They had live music the last time I was there which was a nice touch. I've only had the food once and it was good.  I love to drink in the neighborhood and the fact that it's an Irish bar never hurts!
author: Dominique K.

description: Hate is a strong word overused by humans, but I come close to seriously wishing I had a bomb so I could blow this place up. My friend Al said it best when he is like ,"go to this place and you are asking to get into a fight." The music is fun, lots of covers of songs , but the crowd is too sloppy for my liking. My friend almost had a table fall onto her because dudes were wrestling ...and people are dropping drinks left and right. If i wanted an anxiety attack id drop acid again
author: Lauren V.

description: Best bar in the sunset hands down. The Riptide is okay, but this place has a fireplace, and a big wooden Ireland on the wall. Cozy and warm, just the way a neighborhood bar should be. The Irish breakfast is great, especially with a black and tan. Don't be afraid to get a little Durty...oh man.
author: Robert C.

description:
i seriously felt like i was in ireland.

every person i talked to had this irish accent. I LOVED IT!!!!!

durty nellys im deducting a star because you dont take CARD!!!!!
i couldnt pay for a full round of drinks because i was short $10 (thank you angela for spotting me) but still thats an embarrassing story.

anyways. i organized my friend's birthday extravaganza and i had everyone come here and what a joyous occasion it turned out to be. everyone had a glorious time.

this guy was in the corner with his guitar singing songs and he let one of our friends take the mic to toast to our friend and everyone was into it. i met this old lady granny omally and she was wonderful, throwing drinks back like it was 1954! bartenders were quick and so chatty. i think the guy who owned the bar bought all my friends (there had to be at least 15 of us) a round of shots.

nicest people ive ever met here. everyone was talking to everyone. GREAT ATMOSPHERE.

be careful though...it may be super freezing outside BUT its HELLAAAAAA hott inside.
author: A. V.

description: This place is sweet!  Came here during the day on a saturday and it was decently full of people.  Seems like a lot of Irish people hang out here, and everyone was really friendly.  Nice staff, and the food is actually really tasty!  If you're looking for a good pub out in the sunset, then I would definitely say stop in for a pint and a burger.
author: Kristine C.

description: Nice bartenders, laid back local crowd, cold Smithwick's, warm fire, amazing chicken curry chips. What more do you need to know?
author: Joshua W.

description: Local little Irish gem in the heart of the residential area. Discovered this randomly, and totally love the atmosphere. Am looking forward to the next trip. It's not too big (part of the charm), and you'll be lucky to get a seat. =)
author: Sue Y.

description: My fiance and I were looking for a good fish and chips place and found this pub on Yelp.  Now, it's not the proper chippie I was looking for, but figured we'd give it a try since we were in that area.  The Guiness I had was GREAT-- poured the way it's supposed to where it's stop, settled, and then topped off with the proper amount of foam.  I wanted to try the chicken curry chips, but I went ahead and did the fish and chips even though my fiance was already ordering that too.  It wasn't so bad that I didn't eat it, but it definitely was not the best fish and chips I've had.  They used tilapia for the fish, which I've  never seen anybody use for fish/chips.  It was on the overdone side-- a little too crispy and a little bland.  Despite my lack of enthusiasm for that dish I would probably go back and try other items from the menu and have another good beer.  It was early and pretty quiet in the bar, but I'm sure the vibe there later on is good.
author: LyraM45 H.

description: This place is worth the walk into the Outer Sunset. It's a more intimate pub than the Blackthorn Tavern, so you can carry on a conversation. And the fireplace is quite cozy. I highly recommend the food; their chicken curry and chips is to die for, just like the curry'n'chips truck in auld Oxford.  B had the Shepherd's pie, and it came with little delicious fried mushrooms (who knew those existed?) and the pie itself was decent. I will certainly  return.
author: Kathleen B.

description:
Went on a random monday night with my boy---yes, i know what youre thinking, semi alky status. Walked in and there were definitely a sparse amount of people inside, but they all looked like regulars. comfy, cozy space---and even a fireplace!!! The bartender was amazing; he gave us a sample of the beers before we decided on what to get. I of course had to settle for my renowned Guiness, and the boy settled on a Blue Moon.

We bought 3 songs on the jukebox for a buck, I was groped by a random Irish drunkard who asked me if I had been 'blown in by the northwest wind?', had a conversation about how being a samaritan resulted in another drunk patron's broken leg, and scored a free hot toddy by the bartender who was cherry bombing it up with the rest of us lonely monday night drunkards.

five stars.
author: Nicholas K.

description:
This is hands down, 100% my favorite pub.  This is where my friends take me for my birthday.

The chicken curry and chips is fantastic.  Think about it: take the deliciousness of chicken curry.  Throw away the boring rice.  And serve it on freshly made frys.  Perfect.

Also, Durty Nelly's wins for fastest buy-back ever.  First time there my friends and I got a round of Guinness, dinner with beer, and then a third round.  Then, magically, more Guinness appeared in front of us courtesy of the house.  My jaw dropped.  (Ladies: This is really good for three ugly dudes.)

And I love that this pub feels like an actual public.  It's cool to see family's having dinner there before my fellow drunkards show up.
author: Dolla B.

description: I discovered this place running through the rain in the sunset with my new gentleman caller a few weeks back. We ducked in and were met with a roaring fire, an atmosphere straight out of the homeland, and the best Guinness I've had since I don't know when. We curled up on a booth and ordered wonderful food, all bready-buttery-warmth, within 5 minutes we felt like it was our own private hideaway. We've been back and feeling hasn't dimmed....this place is what an Irish bar should be.
author: Ellen S.

description: Oh man, what an awesome night.  Durty Nelly's totally erased the bad taste in my mouth that Balboa Cafe left earlier that evening (my god that place was awful).  I walk in and people are shouting and cheering and ripping off each other's shirts and dancing like crazy, and immediately all the Marina grossness faded away.  Got a Guinness and put on my figurative dancing shoes and had an awesome time.  And what Irish bar would be complete without two guys completely passed out at the bar?  They were funny to watch--it's a real feat for an unconscious guy to stay upright (and keep his drink upright) while passed out on a small bar stool. Music was great, people were great.  The drive out to the Outer Sunset was NOT great, but I'd do it again just to get to Durty Nelly's.
author: Gina K.

description: I love Durty's!!! Not only is it a rad and pretty authentic Irish bar, but it has amazing food too! Bangers and mash, chicken pot pie, and an EXCELLENT steak sandwich. This is a really cozy bar, with a small fireplace, a locals feeling, U2 often playing over the speakers, and friendly bartenders and service. The bartenders have offered me free shots a few times when I've been there, and that is always a really nice gesture. Overall, a great place to grab some brunch, drink a Smithwicks, and listen to some tunes or watch some sports.  Cheers!
author: Jamie J.

description: Had a post bday, st. patty's day celebration here. It was packed as you can imagine. Fun DJ, nice crowd. My only complaint is that the bathrooms have been sub-sub-standard here any time I go - whether middle of the day, no one else there or packed on St. Patty's. I know, it's a bar, but still. Otherwise, good bartenders, good service, decent prices.
author: Amy E.

description: Went out exploring and ended up at Durty Nelly's.  We certainly could have done worse!  There was a one-man band rocking out in the corner with some U2 covers and other classic (apparently) Irish tunes, and the crowd ranged from 20-somethings out for a fun Friday night to 50-somethings hitting on those 20-somethings.  It was nice to see that inter-generational bonding.  Strong showing by Durty Nelly's.
author: Rachel B.

description: A diamond in the rough...No...an Irish bar in the middle of an Asian block. That's not terribly unique in the Sunset, but Durty Nelly's is. A neighborhood bar with international appeal. Trivia Night (Wednesday's around 9:00) attracts folks from everywhere, as it did the night I won with a tourist from Chicago. Pay a visit. Nelly's is a small, friendly bar with tasty pub food and a welcoming fire.
author: David D.

description: I love this place.  Its everything an Irish pub should be.  There's good food, good beer and I don't feel like someone is going to call Child Protective Services for bringing my kid.  There's even actual Irish people.  Who could ask for more?  I love their Chicken curry and chips or Shepherd's Pie.  Perhaps its because I usually go here on a weeknight or early Sunday, but its never too too crowded or rowdy and the service is fast and friendly.  And its loud enough for no one to hear my toddler yelling at everyone, or they're too drunk to notice so its a win-win situation.
author: Farah G.

description:
i have had a lot of fun drunken nights at this place.  Everyone is always friendly and i am always able to get a drink quickly even when the bar is full to capacity.

definitely recommend it for a casual night of fun
author: callen a.

description: Sweeet sweeeet irish breakfast.  Yum blood sausage.  Bartender and patrons very friendly... one of them bought a round of CA Lotto Scratchers and I won $7 with which I bought him a pint, thus enriching my karma.
author: Marjorie B.

description: When I used to go to this place, all of my friends lived in the Sunset and I used to live right around the corner from this place. Granted, we weren't going 5 nights a week, but we'd give it a shot once a weekend, and no matter how many weeks in a row we'd go, we'd always get those "looks" from all the diehards. It is definitely a neighborhood bar. The bartender is awesome, I've met some VERY friendly Irishmen but overall, not good enough to overlook the awkward intro and the extreme overcrowdedness.
author: Sachi T.

description: Had a craving for a Guinness, and some Irish stew,  so I head over to Durty Nelly's for the first time to scratch that itch.  Unfortunately, they did not have Irish stew,  but they did have fantastic fish and chips, and a pretty good shepherds pie.  The pint of Guinness washed down the meal perfectly, and the atmosphere was quite nice, which draws the local Irish crowd from the surrounding Sunset area. Now, if I could just find a place to get myself some Irish stew.
author: Lucas M.

description: Another great Irish bar in the Avenues!  Cute, cottage setting with great artwork and wonderful people.  Drinking with Vivian, the owner, cracking up with Finnebar, the comedian, taking shots with Maria, the adorable barmaid... it's hard to even think you're in SF until you notice the Chinese folks dancing to Irish music and the multi-national med school table drinking Guinness.  But that's the beauty of it all... everyone loves the Irish!   Maybe I like this bar a little more because my family is "very Cork" but I'll be back in when I need numerous laughs, countless pints, and unforgettable nights.
author: Tara G.

description: Very friendly bar staff and patrons! The food looks good too, but I haven't tried anything yet. I will definitely return since it's in my remote hood.
author: Megan S.

description: This place may be the Michael Jordan of people watching spots, especially if you have a fondness for Irish-style drunkenness. Do not drink with the 10-year-olds underfoot -- they will drink you under the table, and then grab your wallet. The bartenders are inventive, generous and your friends. Unless you're not friends to them. Bonus: my bank is across the street. ATM trips with no service fees for the win!
author: Arsenio S.

description:
cozy placed tucked between a bunch of chinese restaurants.  cheap drinks, cozy atmosphere and a bartender with a true accent.  

one star short from a perfect neighborhood bar because despite being 5'8", the urinals in the bathroom were still nailed in a lot higher than comfortable.  

bitter?  nah.  embarrassed?  a little.
author: Andrew P.

description: I'm kind of torn on this review because on the one hand we came here to hang out with a friend's Gaelic Football team and the club said drinks were on them all night so my fiancee and his friend got tanked for free which is always nice. There were also quite a few rowdy Irish footballers here and I'm talking seriously rowdy. One of them was swinging around what looked like an ornate metal door handle he'd torn off something which let's face it is kind of awesome. But on the other hand the people were a little too crazy for me and there were like three girls in the bar out of like six total girls that were obviously drunk and being passed around and manhandled amongst all the guys which is frankly kind of gross. I think I'll give it a middling three stars.
author: Cathy T.

description:
my friends and i yelped about for a place to meetup and drink before outside lands.  when we got here, half the N train car we were in were here too.  bartenders were super nice and on the ball when attending the bar and though we didn't get food it looked/ smelled pretty damn good when we saw it stroll by.

at one point 3 of us looked around, looked at each and than said, there's a lot of good looking people in here- this is a really good looking crowd.  not 23 and hipster but 30 and well, just flat out good looking. there were even groups of good looking people.  can you imagine living in a world like that. i guess its right here.

i'm coming back.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: I have been frequenting Nelly's since 2000 and it still remains one of my favorite bars in San Francisco! Maybe I am a little bit biased since I know most of the bartenders (well, all of them actually) and get awesome treatment while there. I stopped going for awhile after moving to the east coast, but what I love about this place is that you can go back after 4 years of being away and all of the regulars remember you, and welcome you back with open arms! I also love trivia night, their food (steak sandwich, fries, everything!) and best of all the bartenders and the Irish lads and lassies (and non-Irish people too!) perched on stools, dancing on the booths, or just sharing intimate chats in the booths as the fire place glows in the background. Ahhh, there is no place like a bar that feels like your living room.
author: Catherine C.

description:
how can i not give 5 stars when i walk in to a bar where there's a hawaiian guy singing hawaii songs and dancing couple who's combined age equals more than me and my 5 friend's combined ages!

awesome bartenders

great decor (for a dive)

nice location

fun times.
author: Ameer N.

description: Pretty sweet neighborhood bar. Food, beer, bartenders all good, nothing to complain about. The burgers and Irish breakfast are satisfying. Chicken sandwich was bland, don't bother. Obviously you're here to drink though, and they do their alcohol and beer well. There's usually a fun crowd, and if not you can entertain yourself listening to U2 and people's Irish accents. Definitely worth checking out.
author: Jasmine O.

description: I got a free birthday drink so that was good. Unfortunately I cannot go higher than 2 stars because the smell was unbearable... even for a dive bar. I'll never go back there again. I'm sticking to the Dubliner.
author: Ruth R.

description: I haven't tried the food (although I hear it's decent), but the second I parked outside and saw dudes with flipped collars, ridiculously stressed jeans, and ed hardy hats smoking outside trying too hard to get in some girls pants, I began to regret inviting all my friends. Beer was fairly priced (Smithwicks on tap always wins a few points for me), but everything else was a nightmare. The DJ couldn't stop blaring typical bullshit like Journey and Akon and the bathroom was literally the size of my closet. Trust me, there are MUCH better pubs in the area.
author: Ryan R.

description: Stumbled upon this place in yelp and must say it's not so bad. I don't think it deserves the 5 stars it has gotten, but it's a good irish pub. Drinks were so-so, I wouldn't rate them as any better than other pubs but the atmosphere was great
author: Andrew F.

description: Great fish and chips, plenty o' beer, plus a fire place for those foggy San Francisco nights!
author: rebecca c.

description: Sweet spot!  one of the first couple spots I went by in Frisco... And Brandon the barkeep IS the man...  had plenty fun there...  plenty shots there...  and plenty crazy nights there...  do have to say that from time to time the mix is pretty one sided...  and it can get crazy hot in there too...  like BO and too much cologne...  it gets stinky...  haha... anyways...  still an awesome spot though and looking forward to the next time I'm there...
author: Anthony Z.

description: My husband and I are quickly approaching regular status at Durty Nellys.  This is because it is such a cozy and normal bar (which is difficult to find in the Sunset).  The food is good too.  I'm a big fan of the chicken sandwich with a few Stellas at the end of a long week while enjoying the warm fire place.
author: melissa o.

description:
Great food, excellent service, and a cool atmosphere.  The location is perfect for me (as I live down the street) so I can't complain.

The food here is no ordinary bar food.  It's actually the best American food around.  The burgers are crazy good -- throw an egg on top for a good treat.  The steak sandwiches are actually made with steak.  The curry fries give you a unique lunch.  The fish and chips are crispy and to die for.  Everything comes with "chips", which I guess are just really tasty and fresh french fries.  As a bonus, everything's cheap.  If anything, the food is a bit of a downside because it's so good, people are bringing their families here.  You will usually find 2 or 3 kids running around this place around dinnertime.  :(

The service is totally spot on.  The bartenders quickly make you a regular and have your next drink ready before you can ask.  The prices are totally reasonable for the city and are lower than more populated areas.  The owner is an awesome dude known to buy rounds for the regulars.

Inside there are enough booths that you can usually get one.  It turns into a club type place on the weekends, but I prefer to come here in the middle of the week (if not the middle of the day.)

Durty Nelly's -- the Cheers of the Sunset.
author: Dean A.

description:
Nelly's is an enduring element of the Sunset around Cal 1.  Yes it is an Irish bar, for better or worse, however it is a great place to have lunch or a late dinner.  The food is better than most pub fare in San Francisco.  The chicken sandwich, in particular, is phenomenal (yes, in terms of pub fare).  Late nights can be a bit iffy, especially if the lads who frequent the establisment are hot-blooded; still, it's always interesting to hear the songs they sing at 2am.

Durty Nelly's has both beers on tap and bottled beer, they also have an extensive bar.  One has the impression, however, that much of the hard alcohol has been sitting untouched for years; well, the alcohol that isn't whiskey anyway.  The clientele are VERY Irish, and the bartenders reflect this.  There is live (cover) music most weekends; the choice of music reflects the Irish clientele.

The bar is packed on weekends, and it is a local gathering place for the Sunset Irish.  On weekdays it is rather less busy, and a good place to grab some grub if you have time for lunch.  The kitchen closes rather early but given the crowds at night it is completely understandable.

In all, a great place to have a pub-style lunch during the week and a must for anyone who wants to get a taste of the Sunset Irish culture.  Weekends in particular have a good crowd, full of songs and great stories but relaxed and safe, as far as San Francisco Irish pubs go.
author: John B.

description: The very tasty $10 chicken curry fries are big enough to feed 2-4 people. Plenty of curry sauce, lots of moist, white meat chicken on a mountain of fries make this a winner. Not the most complex curry, but very very tasty bar food. I liked that an older couple (in their 70s maybe) came for a few beers and appeared to be regulars. I wasn't expecting the music though! A few of the bartenders and customers started singing the Black Eyes Peas when they came on.
author: Crystal L.

description: why cant there be an irish pub like this in my city or san mateo county hahaha....i came upon this this lil shack while cruisin the aves~which i should do more often....it for sure had a very irish feel to it..every1 @ the joint (including the bartender) have the accent...the previous yelpers said they serve food =(...maybe sum fish/chips wouldve went well with my couple of glasses of guiness
author: elmer d.

description: beware of the racist assholes at the bar!!  i couldn't believe it.  never in my life have i been confronted with such an ignorant and racist lowlife at a bar/pub/restaurant in san francisco.  it was very disappointing.  the jerk just told me that they didn't like my kind (i am asian) and that i should leave.  i found it particularly offensive as i am actually from the sf bay area and he clearly was not.  thankfully he left instead and i enjoyed the rest of the evening with my multi-cultural group of friends.  there were some friendly people there as well, and the bar staff was cool.  not at the top of my list for a revisit.
author: melita s.

description: ugly Betty just called. she's found a new place to bring her chickies
author: Prima D.

description: It is literally impossible to come out of Durty Nelly's sober. I've gone in for fish and chips at lunch only to come stumbling out after dark. The bartenders are great and they really get to know the locals. I've probably paid for all of three drinks since I started coming here last year. They have live music on Saturdays, and oh if only I could pay homage to whomever invented their cherry bombs. The best part? This place is about 5 minutes from home.
author: Michele L.

description: we came here for a low-key, monday night celebration on my boy's 21st birthday. there was barely anyone there but we had fun nonetheless. the bartender bought us a few songs on the juke box so the boys could air guitar to pink floyd. a very drunk irishman who we couldn't understand did a bono impression for us for no reason at all. i will be back to bring out my quarter irish-ness, drink more guiness, &, based on the other reviews, try some of their grub.
author: Lizzy L.

description: heard about this place for a long while and decided to check it out.  friday afternoon i was tryin to beat the fog and popped in for a pint, robbie the bartender and his highlights served us with great speed and focus.  it was a great night except for the constant interruptions from this drunken guy who looked suspiciously like tori amos! he obviously left his sense of humour home that day! will go back though staff and punters totally awesome!
author: dan m.

description: If this place was closer to where I live, I think I might go here once a week.  A great little Irish pub.  They pour a perfect Guinness.  I had the Shepard's Pie and loved it.  My buddy had the burger w/ cheddar and said it was "better than Polker's", which means pretty solid.  The atmosphere of the bar is awesome -- I think the fireplace really adds a lot.  Granted, I was there on a Sunday night, but the clientele was not a real selling point -- a little older, but that shouldn't be too surprising given the neighborhood.  Also, while the girls they hired to greet were pretty, I found the whole putting green beads around my neck a little annoying.  It was Sunday night, not Mardi Gras.
author: Luke P.

description: Very nice pub with great atmosphere and loads of Irish expats.
author: Elise U.

description: This place is great! I went on a Saturday night to meet up with a bunch of my Irish guy friends --- clearly, the right crowd to be with at an Irish  bar, I was given a free shot as soon as I stepped up to the counter! But apparently that's a common practice, which is uh, amazing? Great bar tender, busy but not overcrowded atmosphere... and a fire place?? If you ever want to meet up with me, well, now you know where to look first...
author: Etta A.

description: I'm not much a pub/bar rat, but I love living near Durty Nelly's - Irish or not, it's just a warm, friendly place to stop in for a drink.  We've gone on weeknights, weekends and holidays - and there's always been room at the bar for us, although I prefer the booth by the fireplace - esp on a classic foggy SF eve.  Big booths on one side, bar on the other, jukebox in the back (healthy supply of Irish bands, natch), and smattering of tables/stools in the front.  Wandered in on Halloween last year not in costume - snagged a table for 6 and had a super fun time.  Heads up that it's a cash-only bar, but there's an ATM at the corner of the block...  Haven't been for food or game night yet, but the menu looks tasty...
author: Joan K.

description:
i ordered a vodka tonic here last night and when it was served to me i could have sworn it was soda water and not the tonic i asked for!  i know what that taste like and i also know it's one of my least favorite tasting things! the bartender insisted it was tonic and i sat there with looking at my foul tasting cocktail knowing that i had to be a nice girl and drink it no matter how much i didn't want to. the bartender comes back and must have read my mind or the look of sadness must have been obvious because he apologized, took my drink and served me a fresh one. he should have said, "ta da" when he served it because he gave me a glass of magic! you know that happiness you get when you reunite with a long last love? Yup, that's what it tastes like! it tasted just like i wanted it to and he was so nice about it too! i was hoping to not become that high maintenance bitch patron they all talk shit about right before i came in or behind my back when going to the bathroom. 
so why just 3 stars? well next time i'm going to order fish and chips to see if it deserves 4! 
also, i'm convinced that all Irish pubs have a steady soundtrack built into their jukeboxes furnished by U2 and the Cranberries!
author: Alexis D.

description: Cute place, felt like I was back home again :) It's intimate and comfy.  The rum and coke was mixed just to my liking.  The owner is really sound and he remembered me from like a year before!  Great little place no fuss just nice drinks music and fun people.  I have not yet had the pleasure of eating here so I can't review that aspect.
author: Kelly L.

description: I wouldn't have believed anyone could improve on a BLT.....but Durty Nelly's BLT is by far the best I've ever had.   It goes down nicely with that ice cold Smithwick's
author: Joyful Jenny H.

description: came here this past Wednesday night. my brother suggested durty nelly's as he needed a drink after a long day at work. when we arrived, there wasn't anywhere for everyone to sit ( our party consisted of 3 guys, 2 girls). we saw an open table for 6 except there was a backpack on the far end of the bench so we thought someone may be sitting there so we waited for someone to sit there, no one showed. so, i sat down at the very far end, upon doing so, this woman who was drinking at the bar turned around, saw that we were about to sit down and, raced to sit at the table. she grabbed some coasters from the bar and meticulously laid them out, showing us that she was waiting for her party to show up (?) i got up and  we all sat at some loose small bar tables, ordered some drinks and finally another table opened up. during the entire time we dined, this lady's party (at the biggest table in the place) NEVER SHOWED UP! WTF. oh well, it was really more funny than anything.  so once we sat down, we ordered our food. the only veggie option on the menu was a grilled cheese sandwich, so that is what I ordered. my bf ordered the Grilled Ham and Cheese and the rest of the table ordered the following: NY Strip Steak (which was well received), Shepherd's Pie, and Fish and Chips (which got rave reviews about how amazingly moist it was) and they all ordered salads (which all 3 didn't have enough dressing). I ordered a snakebite and a guiness, boyfriend a couple ciders, the rest of the table ordered a bombay Sapphire martini (up), a couple smithwicks and another 2 Guinness's. after we were all full and happy, we got the bill which was over $100 (but not too bad for 5 ppl. and drink orders). We decided to put it all on one card and upon paying the bartender was very snippy and said that they only accept cash. 2 ppl. in our party ran out to the bank, we payed the bill and left. Overall it was good food in a nice small locals bar atmosphere with some excellent food and beers, but you have to  get there in time to procure and table and bring plenty of cash. so, because there was no apparent sign age stating that they did not accept cards, i give this a lower rating.
author: Robin H.
